So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst (Retention Analytics Team)
Description:
Job Description

Hi there!

We are Semrush, a global IT company developing our own product – a platform for digital marketers. New stars are born here, so don’t miss your chance. This is our Data Analyst role for those who strive to implement functional processes and drive them to full completion.

We are seeking a Data Analyst with a h2 focus on Data Analysis and Business Intelligence (BI) to join our Retention division. The ideal candidate will support the development, implementation, and deployment of analytics on customer and product data, delivering actionable insights to drive business decisions. A basic understanding of Data Science principles will be beneficial in enhancing the analytical capabilities of our team.

Tasks in the role


Data Analysis & Reporting:
Conduct in-depth analysis of product insights and customer behavior to identify data-driven opportunities for improving customer retention and fostering profitable growth.
Analyze and report on data patterns and customer pain points using various data sources, including structured and unstructured data, benchmarks, and operational metrics.
Create meaningful reports and insights to support hypotheses, driving testing and experimentation.
Provide ad-hoc analysis and reporting to meet the evolving needs of the Retention division.

Business Intelligence:
Design and develop dashboards and reports in BI tools like Tableau or PowerBI, ensuring they are user-friendly and aligned with UI/UX best practices.
Create and maintain reporting specifications for new reports/dashboards and perform testing/validation to ensure data integrity, accessibility, and accuracy.
Consult with Retention division staff to identify new business reporting needs and provide guidance on complex data environments.

Data Systems & Documentation:
Document data analysis efforts, including data sources, reporting specifications, and issue/problem resolutions.
Ensure proper documentation of reporting and analytical tools for future reference and continuity.



Requirements

Who we are looking for

Technical Skills:


Strong experience in SQL and database design.
Proficiency in designing dashboards and reports in BI tools such as Tableau or PowerBI.
Basic knowledge of data science principles, with the ability to apply them to drive actionable insights.
Experience with cloud platforms and cloud storage solutions is a plus.
Understanding of data extraction using API calls.
Professional Skills:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex data clearly and concisely.
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.



Not required, but a plus


2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field
Familiarity with cloud platforms, particularly GCP, is an advantage
Basic programming skills in Python or R for data manipulation and analysis
You share our common values: Trust, because we prefer to speak up and be our true selves; Sense of Ownership, because it’s not worth wasting time on something you don’t believe in; and enthusiasm for Constant Changes, because we are always looking to make things better



A Bit About The Team

You can get to know the team better at one of the interviews, but some brief information about future colleagues will be useful now.

Our team is a dynamic mix of analysts and engineers who collaborate on a wide range of analytics projects, including data analysis, dashboard development, model building, and A/B testing across various domains. We work closely with the Retention division, delivering actionable insights and helping to drive data-driven decisions. What sets us apart is our chill, supportive vibe and a deep belief in success through collaboration. We prioritize teamwork, knowledge sharing, and continuous learning. Everyone’s contributions are valued, and we work together to solve complex problems while keeping the atmosphere positive and fun. If you enjoy a collaborative environment where innovation is encouraged and teamwork drives success, you’ll fit right in!

We will try to create all the right conditions for you to work and rest comfortably


This offer stands for the “hybrid” work format: some days, you work from the office, and some #wfh. Trust us, it’s an efficient way of work. Proven!
Flexible working day start
Unlimited PTO
Hobby benefit
Breakfast, snacks, and coffee at the office
Corporate events
Training, courses, conferences
Gifts for employees



Finally, a Little More About Our Company

Semrush is a leading online visibility management SaaS platform that enables businesses globally to run search engine optimization, pay-per-click, content, social media and competitive research campaigns and get measurable results from online marketing.

We’ve been developing our product for 16 years and have been awarded G2s Top 100 Software Products, Global and US Search Awards 2021, Great Place to Work Certification, Deloitte Technology Fast 500 and many more. In March 2021 Semrush went public and started trading on the NYSE with the SEMR ticker.

10,000,000+ users in America, Europe, Asia, and Australia have already tried Semrush, and over 1,000 people around the world are working on its development. The Semrush team is constantly growing.

Semrush is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or medical condition including medical characteristics, genetic identity, marital status, military service, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state or federal laws. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications.
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

Hi there!

We are Semrush, a global IT company developing our own product – a platform for digital marketers. New stars are born here, so don’t miss your chance. This is our Data Analyst role for those who strive to implement functional processes and drive them to full completion.

We are seeking a Data Analyst with a h2 focus on Data Analysis and Business Intelligence (BI) to join our Retention division. The ideal candidate will support the development, implementation, and deployment of analytics on customer and product data, delivering actionable insights to drive business decisions. A basic understanding of Data Science principles will be beneficial in enhancing the analytical capabilities of our team.

Tasks in the role

  • Data Analysis & Reporting:
    • Conduct in-depth analysis of product insights and customer behavior to identify data-driven opportunities for improving customer retention and fostering profitable growth.
    • Analyze and report on data patterns and customer pain points using various data sources, including structured and unstructured data, benchmarks, and operational metrics.
    • Create meaningful reports and insights to support hypotheses, driving testing and experimentation.
    • Provide ad-hoc analysis and reporting to meet the evolving needs of the Retention division.
  • Business Intelligence:
    • Design and develop dashboards and reports in BI tools like Tableau or PowerBI, ensuring they are user-friendly and aligned with UI/UX best practices.
    • Create and maintain reporting specifications for new reports/dashboards and perform testing/validation to ensure data integrity, accessibility, and accuracy.
    • Consult with Retention division staff to identify new business reporting needs and provide guidance on complex data environments.
  • Data Systems & Documentation:
    • Document data analysis efforts, including data sources, reporting specifications, and issue/problem resolutions.
    • Ensure proper documentation of reporting and analytical tools for future reference and continuity.


Requirements

Who we are looking for

Technical Skills:

  • Strong experience in SQL and database design.
  • Proficiency in designing dashboards and reports in BI tools such as Tableau or PowerBI.
  • Basic knowledge of data science principles, with the ability to apply them to drive actionable insights.
  • Experience with cloud platforms and cloud storage solutions is a plus.
  • Understanding of data extraction using API calls.
  • Professional Skills:
    • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex data clearly and concisely.
    • Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions.
    • Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.


Not required, but a plus

  • 2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms, particularly GCP, is an advantage
  • Basic programming skills in Python or R for data manipulation and analysis
  • You share our common values: Trust, because we prefer to speak up and be our true selves; Sense of Ownership, because it’s not worth wasting time on something you don’t believe in; and enthusiasm for Constant Changes, because we are always looking to make things better


A Bit About The Team

You can get to know the team better at one of the interviews, but some brief information about future colleagues will be useful now.

Our team is a dynamic mix of analysts and engineers who collaborate on a wide range of analytics projects, including data analysis, dashboard development, model building, and A/B testing across various domains. We work closely with the Retention division, delivering actionable insights and helping to drive data-driven decisions. What sets us apart is our chill, supportive vibe and a deep belief in success through collaboration. We prioritize teamwork, knowledge sharing, and continuous learning. Everyone’s contributions are valued, and we work together to solve complex problems while keeping the atmosphere positive and fun. If you enjoy a collaborative environment where innovation is encouraged and teamwork drives success, you’ll fit right in!

We will try to create all the right conditions for you to work and rest comfortably

  • This offer stands for the “hybrid” work format: some days, you work from the office, and some #wfh. Trust us, it’s an efficient way of work. Proven!
  • Flexible working day start
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Hobby benefit
  • Breakfast, snacks, and coffee at the office
  • Corporate events
  • Training, courses, conferences
  • Gifts for employees


Finally, a Little More About Our Company

Semrush is a leading online visibility management SaaS platform that enables businesses globally to run search engine optimization, pay-per-click, content, social media and competitive research campaigns and get measurable results from online marketing.

We’ve been developing our product for 16 years and have been awarded G2s Top 100 Software Products, Global and US Search Awards 2021, Great Place to Work Certification, Deloitte Technology Fast 500 and many more. In March 2021 Semrush went public and started trading on the NYSE with the SEMR ticker.

10,000,000+ users in America, Europe, Asia, and Australia have already tried Semrush, and over 1,000 people around the world are working on its development. The Semrush team is constantly growing.

Semrush is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or medical condition including medical characteristics, genetic identity, marital status, military service, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state or federal laws. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications.

Title: Analista Business Intelligence
Description:
¿Tienes experiencia trabajando en equipos de data engineering y estás buscando un proyecto desafiante en el sector energético?




¡Esta es tu oportunidad! En Grupo NeoElectra, líder en el sector energético y en plena expansión, buscamos un Analista Business Intelligence para nuestras oficinas en Sant Just Desvern (Barcelona).




Si eres una persona resolutiva, motivada y con ganas de crecer profesionalmente en un entorno dinámico, ¡te invitamos a seguir leyendo!




Responsabilidades:




Diseñar, documentar, implementar y desarrollar el datawarehouse de la compañía (desarrollo SQL y Power BI): Implementar procesos ETL para la carga de datos en el datawarehouse conectando con las diferentes fuentes de información (ERP, API's, CRM, archivos .xlsx, .csv etc), limpieza y transformación de datos, etc
Integrar y automatizar la extracción de fuentes de datos internas y externas en la base de datos (ETL) administrando la estructura de datos (control de acceso, mantenimiento, monitorización).
Automatizar procesos de reporte y mejorar la eficiencia de los flujos de trabajo con una mejora continua, propuesta de nuevas implementaciones y soluciones.
Colaborar con diferentes equipos para comprender y/o descubrir necesidades, traducirlas en requisitos funcionales y brindar soluciones BI.
Crear tableros interactivos personalizados para el usuario final para facilitar la consulta y visualización de datos.
Capacitar a los usuarios finales.
Garantizar la integridad y precisión de los datos.




Requisitos:




Ingeniería/ /Matemáticas o máster en ingeniería de datos o data science, o cursos certificados en estos campos.
Programación y gestión de bases de datos (Power BI)
Implementación de soluciones óptimas para la gestión, digitalización y análisis de información
Experiencia trabajando en equipos de data engineering preferiblemente en entornos de datawarehouse en la nube.
Conocimientos/experiencia en lenguajes de programación SQL y Python
Conocimiento de modelado de datos dimensional.
Experiencia previa o conocimiento de Power BI
Familiaridad con el entorno Azure o certificaciones DP-203 o DP-500.




Ofrecemos:




Contrato indefinido.
Formato laboral híbrido, con opción de teletrabajar los viernes.
Horario de lunes a jueves 10:00-17:00 y viernes de 8:00h -15:00h.
Un excelente ambiente de trabajo, donde se valora el desarrollo profesional y personal.
La posibilidad de formar parte de una compañía en pleno proceso de expansión




¡Si te apasiona el sector energético y quieres ser parte de un equipo innovador ¡esperamos tu candidatura!




Únete a Grupo NeoElectra y contribuye con tu talento al éxito y crecimiento de nuestra empresa.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Lo Que Ofrecemos

Your mission:

As a Data Analyst for KION ITS (Industrial Trucks & Services) Production and Order Processing (Inventory) Data, you will extract and analyze data from diverse data sources and systems to successfully implement new pricing strategies and processes.

You will translate commercial operations demands into technical requirements, architecture concepts and interface definitions, finding clever, automated and intelligent solutions and implement those in an independent manner.

Tareas y Cualificaciones

Your profile:


Completed studies in computer science, (business) information systems, (business) mathematics or a comparable education.
Experience in translate business needs into technical specifications and preparing clean and structured data models.
Experience in working with modern data infrastructures und data integration processes.
Used to collaborate closely in interdisciplinary teams with business stakeholders, product managers, data analysts among others.
Experience working with technologies like SAP, SAP Business Warehouse, Power BI, Python, Azure, Dataverse and SQL-based databases.
High degree of initiative and solution orientation
Fluent in English, German is a plus.
Show more
HTML:
Lo Que Ofrecemos

Your mission:

As a Data Analyst for KION ITS (Industrial Trucks & Services) Production and Order Processing (Inventory) Data, you will extract and analyze data from diverse data sources and systems to successfully implement new pricing strategies and processes.

You will translate commercial operations demands into technical requirements, architecture concepts and interface definitions, finding clever, automated and intelligent solutions and implement those in an independent manner.

Tareas y Cualificaciones

Your profile:

  • Completed studies in computer science, (business) information systems, (business) mathematics or a comparable education.
  • Experience in translate business needs into technical specifications and preparing clean and structured data models.
  • Experience in working with modern data infrastructures und data integration processes.
  • Used to collaborate closely in interdisciplinary teams with business stakeholders, product managers, data analysts among others.
  • Experience working with technologies like SAP, SAP Business Warehouse, Power BI, Python, Azure, Dataverse and SQL-based databases.
  • High degree of initiative and solution orientation
  • Fluent in English, German is a plus.

Title: BI Specialist
Description:
Our Manifesto

At Heura we are food activists, and our mission is to provide a solution that leaves animals out of the equation, while feeding millions of people in a sustainable way. Technology gives us the opportunity to build a food system that not only solves our current challenges but also responds to our values.

We also know that great goals can only be achieved by diverse teams of people with different backgrounds, perspectives, orientations, abilities, food tastes, dress sense, and time zones - we don't just accept our differences; we fully support and celebrate them.

But ultimately, we all have one common goal: accelerating the protein transition.

And that’s why we are looking for a BI Specialist! To join the Good Rebels team and help us achieve our mission through facilitating informed and strategic decision making through the analysis and visualization of business-relevant data.

Your Challenge


Business Requirements Analysis: Collaborate with different departments to understand their needs and translate them into technical requirements. Identify key areas for improvement and optimization opportunities through data analysis.
Dashboard Design and Development: Create interactive and visually appealing dashboards to facilitate decision-making. Ensure dashboards are intuitive, easy to use, and tailored to end-users. Utilize data visualization tools such as Power BI.
Data Extraction and Transformation: Obtain data from various sources (databases, ERP systems, CRM systems, etc.) and transform it into usable information. Design and maintain ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure data quality and consistency.
Data Analysis: Perform complex data analyses to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies. Generate ad hoc reports to answer specific business questions.
Data Management: Ensure the integrity, accuracy, and security of the data. Implement and maintain an efficient and scalable data model.
User Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users to help them effectively use the dashboards. Create documentation and user guides for the developed tools and dashboards.
Continuous Improvement: Monitor dashboard performance and make adjustments as needed. Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in BI to continuously improve offered solutions.
Communication and Collaboration: Act as a liaison between the IT department and business areas to ensure alignment of technological and business objectives. Facilitate meetings and presentations to communicate findings and recommend actions based on data analysis.
BI Strategy Development: Contribute to the development and implementation of the company's BI strategy. Ensure BI solutions are aligned with the organization's strategic objectives.
Process Automation: Identify and automate repetitive processes to improve operational efficiency. Implement automatic alerts and notifications based on critical business data.
Power BI ownership: from modelling, data sources, metric calculation, visualizations, service, effective distribution and security access



YOU WILL FEEL COMFORTABLE, ENJOY AND DO GREAT AT THIS ROLE IF YOU HAVE:


A Caring attitude towards our mission and see it as a “personal” problem to be solved professionally.
Desire to help, assist and solve people's needs with a GoodVibes attitude.
Passion for the business and a deep understanding of it to make sure your job at this role is aligned to business needs and goals.
Previous experience in similar roles, ideally at an FMCG company or a high-growth startup.
Computer engineering, computer CFGS or similar. Ideal Power BI Certification.
Proficiency with Microsoft Power BI (Desktop application and the Service, and Gateway). Any other similar BI tool such as Tableau, SAS, Qlik, Sisense, Oracle Analytics Cloud, MicroStrategy or Microsoft Excel would be beneficial.
Be familiar with data sources, data warehouses, data models, data quality, data visualization and data security.
Be able to use SQL, Python, R or other programming languages to manipulate and analyze data.
Be aware of the latest trends and innovations in BI, such as cloud computing, artificial intelligence and big data.
Excel skills with Power Query and Data Modelling
Underlying awareness of SQL Server, or any other Database Management systems
Knowledge of SAP solutions
An analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving mindset to approach everyday challenges.
Ability to prioritize and anticipate opportunities
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both English (mandatory) and Spanish.
Ability to create strong and trustful relationships with internal and external stakeholders.



Heura Life Benefits

To make this world a better place is hard work, so we support our Dream Team with:


Culture of freedom, responsibility, and constructive feedback
An entrepreneurial environment that encourages innovation
Regulatory local labour days + 5 extra ones for Vacations! (capped in 30 labour days yearly)
Flexible working environment
Private Health Insurance or Medical Allowance
Organic coffee, tea & plant-based drinks (in local offices)
Discounted gym memberships
Discounts on Heura’s products
Flexible retribution (in Spain)
After-work gatherings and other cool company events (in local offices)
and…



… Working with top-talented and amazing Good Rebels! 👇🏽

We care deeply, which leads us to have a genuine curiosity to understand the core of challenges and get the right diagnosis in order to recognize what will have the most impact.

We find the best hacker solution to each challenge; if it exists, we go for it, if not, we enjoy creating it. We ensure the structures we build are the most efficient ones: we grow two trees from one seed.

We are also high achievers: we never give up. We are fully focused on generating scalable impact taking end-to-end accountability.

None of this would make sense if we didn’t enjoy the journey. We smile and celebrate every day because we are passionate about our work and our mission.

If you see yourself here and can meet the essential requirements, we would love for you to apply. Or, do you know someone who would be a perfect fit? Let them know!

Our mission is to build a net-positive food system by accelerating the protein transition with the ambition of not just being an alternative to current problems but successors by creating value chains that integrate what matters and empowering people to be part of this change.

🌿💛

Title: Data Analyst sector Automoción
Description:
CT es una empresa líder en tecnología, que proporciona servicios de innovación e ingeniería en los sectores aeronáutico, espacial, naval, automovilístico, ferroviario, energético y de plantas industriales. CT impulsa los límites de la tecnología a través de la innovación, y lleva la eficiencia a otro nivel cubriendo todo el ciclo de vida de los productos, desde el diseño y la fabricación hasta el soporte postventa. Con más de 30 años de experiencia, el éxito de CT está impulsado hoy en día por más de 1.800 ingenieros expertos repartidos en siete países, en tres continentes.

Actualmente Estamos Buscando Incorporar Ingeniero/as De Datos Para Diferentes Proyectos De Automoción En Las Empresas Más Importantes Del Sector En Barcelona, Para La Realización De Las Siguientes Tareas


Analizar datos de producción, calidad y rendimiento de vehículos para identificar mejoras operativas y optimizar procesos.
Crear informes y dashboards visuales para comunicar insights a equipos de ingeniería, manufactura y dirección.
Colaborar con diferentes departamentos para implementar soluciones basadas en datos que mejoren la eficiencia y la calidad del producto.
Formación en Ingeneria
Experiencia previa en automoción
Valorable experiencia en departamentos de I+D o departamento de test/validaciones.
Nivel de Ingés alto
Conocimientos en lenguajes de programación
Manejo de bases de datos
Conocimientos de IA, IoT y Big Data


¿Qué ofrecemos?


Modalidad de trabajo híbrida (3 días presenciales y 2 días de teletrabajo).
Horario de 08h a 17:30h, viernes media jornada.
Desarrollo profesional continuo.
Retribución competitiva.
Clima laboral participativo, inclusivo y dinámico. ¡Nos encanta trabajar en equipo!
Formar parte del lugar donde los ingenieros aman trabajar.


Buscamos una persona proactiva, motivada, con ganas de seguir creciendo en el mundo industrial, con ganas de nuevos retos dentro del mundo tecnológico.

Si te sientes identificado no dudes en aplicar!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Somos una de las entidades financieras de referencia de crédito al consumo en el mercado español. Con 30 años de historia en nuestro país, hemos acompañado a más de dos millones y medio de clientes para hacer realidad sus proyectos. Estamos respaldados por el grupo Crédit Mutuel, el cuarto banco más importante en Francia, y el holding Argosyn. Ambos nos proporcionan el soporte financiero y tecnológico necesario para diseñar, vender y gestionar una amplia gama de productos de crédito al consumo, préstamos personales, tarjetas, líneas de crédito, soluciones de pago y seguros.




Estamos buscando para nuestras oficinas ubicadas en Cornellà de Llobregat a un/a Business Intelligence Analyst.




Entre tus funciones y responsabilidades:




Reunión con usuarios para la toma de requerimientos con el fin de transformarlos en KPI's significativos que ayuden a monitorear e impulsar el negocio.
Revisión crítica, positiva y constructiva del ecosistema de informes que faciliten la lectura del dato (data visualization).
Proponer nuevas formas de evaluar la evolución de la actividad de la empresa y su impacto en cada eje.
Automatización de los procesos recurrentes solicitados por las Direcciones de cada servicio.
Sintetizar la información presentando resúmenes y gráficos críticos que aporten el dato más destacado.
Apoyo y comunicación con el área de arquitectura del dato ante nuevos datos solicitados por el usuario.
Participación en proyectos de la compañía.




¿Qué esperamos de ti?




Formación universitaria, preferentemente en Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería o similar. Valorable formación complementaria en Data Analytics.
Experiencia mínima de 4-5 años como BI Analyst / Data Analyst.
Conocimientos en herramientas de visualización de datos.
Conocimiento avanzado de SQL. Muy valorable SAS.
Persona proactiva con buenas habilidades comunicativas, gran capacidad para trabajar en equipo, asegurar la fiabilidad y rigor del dato.




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?




Contratación indefinida.
Formación continuada.
Posibilidades de desarrollo profesional.
Modelo Híbrido de trabajo (2 días desde casa, 3 en la oficina).
Salario fijo + variable y otros beneficios sociales (ticket restaurant,...).

Show more

Title: Data Analytics
Description:
Who We Are

We simplify wealth creation. Founded in 2014 in Vienna, Austria by Eric Demuth, Paul Klanschek and Christian Trummer, we’re here to help people trust themselves enough to build their financial freedom — for now and the future. Our user-friendly, trade-everything platform empowers both first-time investors and seasoned experts to invest in the cryptocurrencies, crypto indices, stocks*, precious metals and commodities* they want — with any sized budget, 24/7. Our global team works across different cultures and time zones, bringing our products to more than 4 million customers, making us one of Europe’s safest and most secure platforms that powers modern investing.

Headquartered in Austria but operating across Europe, our products are built by fast-moving, talented, “roll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen” kind of people. It’s these diverse perspectives and innovative minds operating as ONE TEAM that keep Bitpanda at the cutting edge of our industry. So if you’re someone who thinks big, moves fast and wants to make an impact right from day one, then get ready to join our industry-changing team. Let’s go!

Your mission

Do you want to join a growing team of data enthusiasts who operate a modern data platform and build user-friendly data products? Are you passionate about enabling decision making and constantly learning with us? Then our Data Engineering team will be perfect for you!

What You’ll Do


Contribute to the ongoing design of our core data model to support advanced analytics and reporting.
Engage and collaborate with stakeholders to identify reporting needs/requirements and potential enhancements early on.
Ensure high data quality of the core data layer.
Enable analysts across the whole organisation.
Contribute to team strategy and roadmapping to align the team’s efforts with broader organisational goals.



Who You Are


Strong experience with SQL, Python and dbt - Airflow is a plus.
Hands-on experience with data-modelling
Understanding of different data-modelling concepts (dimensional modelling, OBT, …) and data quality
Willingness to learn and to grow with the team



What’s In It For You


Hybrid-working model with a 50/50 split between in-office and home, plus 60 Work From Anywhere days annually
Total compensation package including participation in our Bitpanda stock option plan
Competitive benefits programs and policies shaped by our flexibility-first philosophy
Exclusive premiums when trading on Bitpanda
Company-wide and team events — both in-person and virtually!
Bitpanda swag to keep you living the brand



And, above all, the opportunity to learn and grow as part of Bitpanda’s incredible journey towards being Europe’s future #1 investment platform.

Bitpanda is committed to fostering a fair and equal environment based on trust and mutual respect. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace is paramount to our success and we are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.

Title: Business Insights Analyst
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

We are looking for a world-class analyst to become part of our SEE (Southeastern Europe) Growth team. Are you able to translate data into actionable insights? Are you looking for a challenging experience in the fast and rapidly changing environment helping to build a product that will disrupt the On-demand market? If your answer is YES and you are eager to join a strongly data-driven and results-focused team we are looking forward to meeting you!

THE JOURNEY


Understand business needs of SEE countries under your scope and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisions to boost Glovo presence and orders.
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base focusing on traffic, conversion and retention rates and leveraging on levers such as pricing, promotions, events, CRM and other marketing levers etc.
Drive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actions
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitability
Take ownership of the reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools and using the available ones
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
Assist your colleagues in gaining access to the right data, and Communicate and simplify concepts to the audience's needs
Drive clarity and solve ambiguity using data-driven approaches
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products, identify growth opportunities, and execute on projects to drive growth and engagement


What You Will Bring To The Ride


2-3 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actions
Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Business, Stats or Quantitative field
SQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plus
Ninja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a must
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker or Qlikview
Business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation).
Hands-on attitude is a must. You’ll have to roll up your sleeves!
Proficiency in English
Strong consumer understanding skills


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Controller Financiero/a y Analista de Datos
Description:
El/La candidato/a se responsabilizará de la preparación de informes financieros, la gestión de presupuestos y la implementación de controles internos para asegurar la precisión y la integridad de la información financiera. El/la controller financiero trabaja estrechamente con la alta dirección para apoyar la toma de decisiones estratégicas y garantizar la estabilidad financiera de la organización.




Responsabilidades Principales:




Planificación Financiera y Presupuestaria:




Realizar análisis de variaciones presupuestarias y proponer acciones correctivas.




Informes Financieros:




Preparar estados financieros mensuales, trimestrales y anuales.
Análisis de les diferencies en los reportings financieros, explicación y plan de acción y seguimiento del mismo.




Análisis Financiero:




Realizar análisis financieros detallados para apoyar la toma de decisiones.
Evaluar la rentabilidad de proyectos y propuestas de inversión.
Identificar y analizar tendencias financieras, riesgos y oportunidades.




Control Interno y Cumplimiento:




Implementar y mantener sistemas de control interno efectivos.
Asegurar el cumplimiento de políticas financieras internas y regulaciones externas.
Participar en auditorías internas y externas, y gestionar la implementación de recomendaciones.




Requisitos del Puesto:




Formación:




Título universitario en Contabilidad, Finanzas, Economía o campos relacionados.
Deseable un máster en Finanzas, MBA o certificaciones profesionales.
Conocimientos en automatización de procesos financieros utilizando scripts de Python.
Excel avanzado, incluyendo el uso tablas dinámicas y modelado financiero complejo (uso de Power Query valorado).







Experiencia:




Mínimo de 5 a 7 años de experiencia en roles financieros, preferiblemente en control financiero o auditoría.
Experiencia en el manejo y análisis de grandes volúmenes de datos mediante el uso de bases de datos (Access, SQL, u otros sistemas relacionados).
Experiencia en la integración de sistemas ERP con herramientas de análisis de datos para mejorar la eficiencia y precisión de los reportes financieros.







Conocimientos y Habilidades Técnicas:




Experiencia en el manejo y análisis de grandes volúmenes de datos mediante el uso de bases de datos (Access, SQL, u otros sistemas relacionados).
Conocimientos en automatización de procesos financieros utilizando scripts de Python.
Excel avanzado, incluyendo el uso tablas dinámicas y modelado financiero complejo (uso de Power Query valorado).
Familiaridad con herramientas de visualización de datos como Power BI o similares.
Experiencia en la integración de sistemas ERP con herramientas de análisis de datos para mejorar la eficiencia y precisión de los reportes financieros.
Capacidad para desarrollar y optimizar procesos automatizados que reduzcan errores y mejoren la eficiencia en la elaboración de informes financieros.
Orientación a la innovación tecnológica y mejora continua en el ámbito financiero.
Conocimiento profundo de principios contables y normativas fiscales.
Dominio de software financiero y de contabilidad puesto que se trabaja con gran volumen de datos. (ERP, Excel, etc.).
Nivel de ingles medio-alto (ser capaz de hacer reportings en inglés de y de explicarlos)
Capacidad para trabajar bajo presión y cumplir con plazos estrictos.
Acostumbrado/a a trabajar con varios departamentos. el candidato/a estará en estrecha colaboración con el controllers industrial y con el director financiero.
Deseable conocimientos de controlling industrial e involucración en el departamento administrativo financiero.




Competencias:




Pensamiento analítico y estratégico.
Orientación a resultados y atención al detalle.
Habilidad para resolver problemas y tomar decisiones.
Integridad y ética profesional.
Trabajo en equipo

Show more

Title: Game Data Analyst
Description:
Ready for your next adventure?




We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile games studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games are positioned in the top rankings of both iOS and Android, and they are played and loved by millions of fans all over the world. We are proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, and we are on a mission to offer a great gaming experience and bring fun to everyone! We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Game Data Analyst into our Analytics team, where you will be part of the Two Dots analytics team, work to understand our gamers’ behavior, and work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion. Applying quantitative analysis, data science, statistics & programming, you’ll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint . To truly make an impact you’ll need to learn quickly & work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with analytics & game teams.







What will you do in Socialpoint?




Work with the game development teams to provide insights into user behavior and answer key business questions, turning our vast amount of data into actionable insights and transferable learnings.
Visualize and communicate the results of your analysis to senior stakeholders, making data driven recommendations that support key decisions.
Design and analyze A/B tests and other causal impact analysis to assess the impact of new features and changes.
Continuously educate stakeholders on data literacy and analytics best practices, to ensure they are empowered and autonomous to run analytically correct analysis.
Occasionally participate in advanced analytics projects, teaming up with other game data scientists & analysts to develop data tools and products.







Requirements




2-3 years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value.
A bachelor degree in a quantitative field (e.g Stats, Maths, Physics, Engineering).
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis.
Experience with A/B testing.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics. Prior experience with bayesian statistics is a plus.
Experienced creating dashboards and visualizing findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.
Experienced designing and analyzing randomized experiments.
A fast learner, highly meticulous and proactive individual.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.







What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?




Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we have employed a hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office so you are able to come into the office for important meetings/events.

We have a hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office so you are able to come into the office once a week or when you have important meetings/events.

Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you’re not already here).
An impressive 25 days annual leave, plus a week in December (not including public holidays).
Monthly meal allowance at the office. Breakfast, Lunch and snacks included.
Private medical insurance for you and your family, to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons (English, Catalan & Spanish ).
Spotify Premium to add that special soundtrack that every adventure deserves.
Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam.
Players develop…Oops, sorry! People development is key for us: an amazing budget just for you to spend skilling up your abilities & knowledge to achieve real growth opportunities!







Benefits




Coming to work in the office? Don’t worry - we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:

State of the art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for your aches and pains.
A massive gaming room equipped with all consoles and games you could ask for.
Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).
Amazing catering for Breakfast and Lunch with our specialty coffee
Wellness room.
Gaming room .







Intrigued? We’d love to hear from you. Please click “apply” to level up and submit your application in English.




Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You’re welcome on the team no matter where you’re from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It’s a trick question – mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

Show more
HTML:
Ready for your next adventure?


We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile games studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games are positioned in the top rankings of both iOS and Android, and they are played and loved by millions of fans all over the world. We are proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, and we are on a mission to offer a great gaming experience and bring fun to everyone! We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Game Data Analyst into our Analytics team, where you will be part of the Two Dots analytics team, work to understand our gamers’ behavior, and work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion. Applying quantitative analysis, data science, statistics & programming, you’ll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint . To truly make an impact you’ll need to learn quickly & work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with analytics & game teams.



What will you do in Socialpoint?


  • Work with the game development teams to provide insights into user behavior and answer key business questions, turning our vast amount of data into actionable insights and transferable learnings.
  • Visualize and communicate the results of your analysis to senior stakeholders, making data driven recommendations that support key decisions.
  • Design and analyze A/B tests and other causal impact analysis to assess the impact of new features and changes.
  • Continuously educate stakeholders on data literacy and analytics best practices, to ensure they are empowered and autonomous to run analytically correct analysis.
  • Occasionally participate in advanced analytics projects, teaming up with other game data scientists & analysts to develop data tools and products.



Requirements


  • 2-3 years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value.
  • A bachelor degree in a quantitative field (e.g Stats, Maths, Physics, Engineering).
  • Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis.
  • Experience with A/B testing.
  • Strong analytical skills in applied statistics. Prior experience with bayesian statistics is a plus.
  • Experienced creating dashboards and visualizing findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.
  • Experienced designing and analyzing randomized experiments.
  • A fast learner, highly meticulous and proactive individual.
  • Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
  • A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.



What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?


Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we have employed a hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office so you are able to come into the office for important meetings/events.

We have a hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office so you are able to come into the office once a week or when you have important meetings/events.

  • Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you’re not already here).
  • An impressive 25 days annual leave, plus a week in December (not including public holidays).
  • Monthly meal allowance at the office. Breakfast, Lunch and snacks included.
  • Private medical insurance for you and your family, to keep your health bar full.
  • Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
  • Free language lessons (English, Catalan & Spanish ).
  • Spotify Premium to add that special soundtrack that every adventure deserves.
  • Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam.
  • Players develop…Oops, sorry! People development is key for us: an amazing budget just for you to spend skilling up your abilities & knowledge to achieve real growth opportunities!



Benefits


Coming to work in the office? Don’t worry - we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:

  • State of the art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
  • Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for your aches and pains.
  • A massive gaming room equipped with all consoles and games you could ask for.
  • Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).
  • Amazing catering for Breakfast and Lunch with our specialty coffee
  • Wellness room.
  • Gaming room .



Intrigued? We’d love to hear from you. Please click “apply” to level up and submit your application in English.


Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You’re welcome on the team no matter where you’re from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It’s a trick question – mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

Title: HR Data Analyst (100% remote-friendly within Spain/Poland)
HTML:
Welcome to the good side of tech 👋

You might have heard about us, but with a different name: Doctoralia. It all started 10 years ago, when we asked ourselves: is anyone in healthcare thinking about patients? We jumped in and we empowered patients by giving them access to leave and read reviews about their visit. We then provided doctors with the technology to manage bookings easily and save time, so they could devote themselves to what they always wanted: treating patients. And today is the day in which we ask you: will you join us in the next step of making the healthcare experience more human?

Docplanner at scale

We are leaders in 13 countries so far, and more than 90 million patients trust us every month. Almost 300.000 specialists believe in us and our product, and so do leading venture capital funds such as Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Asset Management and One Peak Partners. And yet, employing over 2.700 people all over the globe, we managed to keep the startup-mindset we started with over 10 years ago.


Job Description

Our primary objective is to assist business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing global reports as the primary and most reliable source of information. A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.

How would you be impacting our mission?

  • Derive facts from data and translate them into actionable insights and recommendations;
  • Support the People Experience (HR) team with identifying opportunities and making intelligent, data-driven decisions. You will execute end-to-end data projects and be the main point of contact for the internal stakeholders;
  • Leverage reporting, data analytics, data quality and visualization to provide insights for routine and ad-hoc operational requests;
  • Co-creating key definitions of KPIs, and ensuring their global alignment.


Qualifications

What will help you thrive?

  • Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights;
  • Have 2+ years of experience in the business/ data/ HR analysis area;
  • Experience in working with business oriented teams, knowing how to adjust their way of explanation to the audience;
  • Experience in data management and visualization (experience in Tableau is a plus);
  • Experience in conducting quantitative and qualitative research; can work with multiple sources of data;
  • Experience in leading and executing end-to-end Data projects;
  • Strong presentation skills, with the ability to influence and engage diverse audiences;
  • Strong written and oral communication skills in English.

Which skills are ‘bonus points’?

  • Have a degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field;
  • Experience in working in an international team;
  • Can take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens;
  • Like to see the instant effects of your work;
  • Are careful, diligent, and detail-oriented.


Additional Information

What will you get in return?

Let’s talk money

  • Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
  • Share options plan after 6 months of working with us.

True flexibility and work-life balance

  • Remote first in one of our legal entities or hybrid work model in one of our office locations;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Paid time off according to your location of work;
  • Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).

Health comes first

  • Health insurance according to your location of work;
  • Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.

What does the recruitment process look like?

  • A 30-minute Screening Call with one of our Talent Acquisition Partners: Lilly Kilian or Anna Reinhardt;
  • Meet our CPO Lucjan Samulowski within two separate 60-minute meetings.
  • A 60-minute technical interview with Wiktor Kulikowski - BI Manager
  • A 60-minute business case review with Lucjan and Wiktor

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you’re reading, there’s a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we’re lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you’ve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.

“We believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.” Mariusz Gralewski, CEO

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

You're an original. So are we.

We're a company of people who like to forge our own path. We invented the blue jean in 1873, and we reinvented khaki pants in 1986. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines in manufacturing. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do. Our brands stand for freedom and self-expression around the world.

Where we lead, others follow. For more than 160 years, we've used the strength of our brands to lead with our values and make an outsized impact on the world. We employ more than 15,000 people globally to support our great brands: Levi's®, Dockers®, Denizen®, Signature by Levi Strauss & Co.™ and Beyond Yoga.

About The Job

Levi’s is looking for a seasoned Analyst and Data Visualization Expert to support the data science and analytics team focused on Direct To Consumer data products. The ideal candidate is a great storyteller and strong technical contributor who has experience solving business problems with data-driven tools. You will be responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products including analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations with especial focus on clickstream data. You will collect, analyze, and present data to improve strategic decision making and to track the benefits unlocked by the data products. You should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. You should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.


Conduct analysis to estimate expected value of data products. Measure and track benefits created by data products, and convert them to financial or key KPI metrics
Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital features and AI model performance through hypothesis testing. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
Partner with data and engineering teams to improve instrumentation and product/models health reporting, pre/post analysis and business debugging.
Partner with A/B test team to design experiments and post-hoc analysis of results.
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.


About You


3+ years of professional experience analyzing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Tableau and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Google BigQuery).
Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarize, and analyze data.
Hands on experience working with big data, ideally clickstream data, in big data volume sectors such as ecommerce, gaming, social network etc. ecommerce platforms are a plus.
Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.


LOCATION

Barcelona, Spain

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.
Show more

Title: Data & Analytics Junior Consultant - Azure
Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

In a fast-changing and uncertain world, the right insights make the difference between seizing an opportunity and missing it entirely. EY Knowledge helps EY to win in the market by providing the right insights at the right time through an agile, client-first organization.

The Oportunity

You will be the overall responsible for the development and execution of various projects, leading a team, ensuring the successful completion of all project phases from requirements gathering to production deployment. This includes the following aspects: technical-functional definition, ETL development and data modeling, visualization, as well as conducting training sessions and overseeing the rollout among other key aspects.

Primary Responsibilities

You will participate in the definition and functional analysis in close collaboration with the client, ensuring solutions tailored to their needs. You will work on a daily basis with SQL databases, data modeling using ETL tools, and data warehouse environments in Azure technology (i.e., Data Lake, Synapse, Data Factory, Power BI).

Your responsibilities will extend to internal and external training on relevant tools for the team, identifying necessary training and certifications for team growth. You will stay updated on the latest technological trends, with a particular emphasis on Data & Analytics, through continuous commitment to training and proactive exploration of new innovations in the sector.

You will closely collaborate with your Manager on operational activities, including team hour input management, forecasting analysis for the upcoming months, etc

Competencies / Skills:


Fluent in Spanish and English
Minimum of 1 year of experience working as a consultant/developer in data platforms, participating in end-to-end Data & Analytics projects
Education in Computer Engineering, Telecommunications, Data Science, Industrial Engineering, or holding a Higher Education degree or another academic path that has provided you with the capacity for development and critical thinking in this environment.
Additional training in Analytics, Big Data, or a similar discipline will be highly valued.
Communicative, analytical, and business-oriented skills to understand project contexts and assist in decision-making for our clients. Demonstrating a proactive and participatory attitude is important.
Proven abilities and experience in project management, teamwork, and adaptation to changing environments effectively while optimizing available resources. Results-oriented, independence, autonomy, dynamism, and freshness in decision-making, improvisation skills, and agility in day-to-day problem-solving.
Desirable to have worked in consulting firms to understand the needs and day-to-day dynamics of our organization. Solid knowledge in Data & Analytics technologies, with demonstrated experience in SQL development, ETL technologies, and visualization with a focus on Power BI. Knowledge in data modeling, with particular relevance to adaptation to Cloud environments (AWS, Azure, Google). Previous experience in consumption of data coming from SAP sources is valuable.


Technical Skills


Microsoft Azure:
Data Factory
Synapse
Data Lake
Power BI
OpenAI
Machine Learning
AWS and Google Cloud as nice to haves


What We Offer


Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Retail Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Retail Media EMEA Analytics team, part of the rapidly expanding Criteo Retail Media business, leverages our grand set of shopper data to design and develop actionable insights for our Retailer and Brand clients. We bring the analytical perspective onto the business and provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry and products. We leverage our unique position to provide our commercial teams and clients with visibility into shopper behavior, market trends and product performance that can't be found anywhere else.

Criteo’s high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position requires working with large sets of data and a variety of stakeholders to solve complex business problems by thinking strategically and proposing innovative solutions. The ideal candidate functions with minimal oversight and has the ability to learn new concepts quickly.


Mine massive data sets and turn them into understandable and actionable insights
Build scalable analytic solutions using state of the art tools of Criteo analytics stack (Hadoop, Vertica, PySpark…)
Develop innovative analytical approaches to measure Brands & Retailers’ performance from design to presentation of results, leveraging all our expertise in Data Science (statistical thinking, A/B testing, bootstrapping, data visualization…)
Frequently interact with other teams (R&D, product, commercial teams…) and clients to share data-driven recommendations and insights
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products and technologies as they evolve



Who You Are:

You are passionate about data and want to work with leading edge technologies in online industry:


You have at least 2 years’ experience in Data Science or Data Analytics
Master’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, etc.)
Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science/Data Analytics: SQL is required, Python is a real asset (master most common data libraries: pandas, numpy…)
Outstanding analytical skills: passion for translating data-speak into relevant, compelling stories
A background in the digital industry or consulting is a plus
You have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
You are fluent in English



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.


Show more

As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
SegurCaixa Adeslas es la compañía No Vida líder en España en seguros de salud, con una cuota de mercado en torno al 30%. Integrada en el Grupo Mutua Madrileña y participada por CaixaBank, la aseguradora ocupa también una posición relevante en otros ramos principales como Hogar, Accidentes o Decesos.




En los últimos años se ha convertido en una entidad de referencia gracias a la implantación de un modelo de negocio basado en el crecimiento sostenido y rentable, que sitúa al cliente en el centro de la estrategia. A través de su acuerdo de bancaseguros con CaixaBank, SegurCaixa Adeslas comercializa sus productos en la mayor red bancaria de España. Adicionalmente, la aseguradora cuenta con una red tradicional con más de 4.000 puntos de venta y atención al cliente.




Estamos convencid@s de que las personas son el principal valor de nuestra compañía y por eso SegurCaixa Adeslas se muestra absolutamente comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades entre hombres y mujeres. Nuestro Plan de Igualdad persigue hacer efectivo este principio y por ello, el proceso de selección de nuestras ofertas garantiza la igualdad de oportunidades a todas las candidaturas.




Seleccionamos para incorporar en Barcelona a un/a Senior Data Analyst para el Dpto. de Planificación y Gestión de la Información.

Las funciones a realizar serán las siguientes:




Elaborar seguimientos comerciales sobre las campañas desarrolladas por Marketing.
Anticiparse a las necesidades de la Dirección General de Negocio en la definición, mantenimiento y creación de informes de seguimiento comercial.
Revisar y garantizar la fiabilidad de los datos que se muestran en los seguimientos, así como su distribución en plazo.
Realizar mejoras en los informes de seguimiento actuales e implementar automatizaciones que permitan ahorrar tiempo para desarrollar nuevas tareas.
Realizar presentaciones ah-hoc para la Dirección y la red comercial.
Buscar nuevas fuentes de datos para la realización de nuevos informes de seguimiento.
Auditar las fuentes origen de información a fin de mantener la fiabilidad de los datos.
Interacción con el área de sistemas para llevar a cabo el desarrollo de requerimientos, revisión de funcionales y validación de pruebas de las peticiones realizadas por Negocio.




Requisitos:




Formación: Titulación universitaria (Matemáticas/Ingeniería/Informática/ADE o Economía o similares).
Experiencia: 8-10 años desarrollando funciones similares en empresas del sector asegurador y/o consultoría.
Informática y aplicaciones: Programación en SQL y VBA, Business Objects y nivel experto en Ms Office (Access, Excel, PowerPoint).
Experiencia en la gestión de bases de datos y en la coordinación de proyectos.




Ofrecemos:

Contrato indefinido y flexibilidad de horarios
Desarrollo profesional dentro de empresa líder en el sector
Interesantes beneficios sociales

Title: Data Analyst II RTO (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Are you passionate about utilizing data to drive operational excellence? Join our Real Time Operations team as a Data Analyst and play a pivotal role in uncovering insights that optimize our global operations. If you thrive in fast-paced environments and want to contribute to reshaping real-time operations on a global scale, we're excited to hear from you.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with product managers, business operations, and data engineering to guide product in problem discoveries, monitor and give visibility of product metrics and KPIs.
Translate product and business questions into analysis and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Own end-to-end everything analytics related to real-time operations products development cycle, from data requirement gathering and opportunity sizing, to experimentation and post-launch impact analyses.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business, and product.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (A/B test, multivariate test, clustering, supervised learning, etc) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


+2 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role, preferably in product facing teams
Experience with the application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide product-shaping insights
Excellent SQL skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Jupyter/iPython notebooks
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau and Looker
Excellent spoken and written English


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
