Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
Description:
¡Capitole sigue creciendo y queremos hacerlo contigo!




Buscamos un consultor de Business Intelligence para juntarse a nuestro equipo!




𝗙𝘂𝗻𝗰𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗲𝘀:

• Consolidar los datos de las diferentes áreas de negocio mediante ETL en Pentaho

• Integración de los datos en el Datawarehouse: BD Analitica Vertica

• Soporte a la herramienta de explotación de datos Tableau.




Requisitos:

• Conocimientos en software de creación de ETLs (deseable Pentaho)

• Haber trabajado con algún software de visualización de datos (deseable Tableau )

• Acostumbrado a manejar grandes volúmenes de datos

• Conocimientos en administración de base de datos

• Capacidad de aplicar técnicas de optimización en consultas/procesos

• Experiencia accediendo a fuentes remotas vía API

• Familiarizado con el manejo de logs

• Capacidad de adaptación y resolución de tareas de manera autónoma

• Alta grado de adaptación a trabajo en grupo, habilidades de comunicación con

miembros de otros equipos




Oficinas ubicadas en el Valles Occidental, con teletrabajo híbrido (3 días remoto, 2 en oficina) y flexibilidad horaria total




🎉¿Por qué Capitole?

🤝 Nuestros empleados lo primero. Creemos en un modelo diferente, más humano, colocamos a las personas en el centro de nuestra empresa.

👨‍💻 Proyectos interesantes. Tecnologías de vanguardia. Metodologías ágiles.

🎓1200€ anuales de formación a la carta

🕓 Horario flexible (incluido posibilidad de hacer jornada intensiva todos los días)

🌏 Más de 550 profesionales cualificados, con hasta 24 nacionalidades

🎯 Trayectoria profesional a medida

🩺 Seguro médico privado

💰 Retribución flexible

🦾 Plan Andjoy

🥳 Un montón de eventos increíbles!

⚽ Equipo de Fútbol patrocinado por Capitole

💻Comunidades tecnológicas para que compartas tus conocimientos e ideas con los demás equipos. ¡¡¡Compartir el conocimiento interno es fundamental!!!




¿Aún no nos conoces? ¡¡Descúbrenos!!




https://capitole-consulting.com/




No dudes en enviarnos tu perfil, ¡estamos deseando conocerte!☎📩

Title: Data energy analytics (M/H) - Barcelona
Description:
En Veolia nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un/a Analista en Eficiencia Energética, para incorporarse a nuestro equipo de Hubgrade en nuestras oficinas centrales de Zona Franca




Descripción del empleo



Como analista, deberá supervisar y analizar los contratos vigentes desde un punto de vista energético. El objetivo principal de la posición es poder optimizar los recursos energéticos que están a nuestro alcance y, así alcanzar la eficiencia energética.


Funciones:


Supervisión y optimización de los contratos de servicios energéticos, mediante el seguimiento de sus consumos, demandas, KPIs,... para identificar oportunidades de mejora en eficiencia energética.
Análisis de Datos energéticos: Utilizar técnicas de análisis y herramientas de visualización de datos para identificar tendencias, anomalías, que ayuden a anticipar la consecución de objetivos en los distintos proyectos.
Creación de cuadros de mando para uso interno y para cliente.
Supervisión y ejecución de los cierres mensuales para la emisión de facturas a cliente.
Elaboración del budget energético y de modelos de previsión de demanda de los contratos en cartera.
Conocimiento de Mercados energéticos y facturación de Comercializadoras.
Elaboración de reportes sobre el avance de los distintos proyectos.

Ofrecemos:


Jornada completa de lunes a viernes, con flexibilidad de horario en la entrada y salida (Viernes intensivo)
Agosto: jornada intensiva
1 día de teletrabajo a la semana
Contrato indefinido
Salario: a negociar según valía del/la candidato/a
Plan de desarrollo profesional
Retribución flexible (opcional)
Servicio de gimnasio, restauración en oficinas centrales... (una parte subvencionado por la empresa)


Requisitos


Disponer mínimo de 2 años de experiencia en una posición similar
Disponer de estudios en Ingeniería de la Energía o Industrial
Certificación CMVP de EVO para medida y verificación de ahorros (valorable).
Destreza en el uso de herramientas de análisis de datos y de software de visualización.
Conocimiento de instalaciones de climatización, frío, vapor, biomasa, fotovoltaica,.. tanto del sector terciario como industriales.
Conocimientos en residuos y agua (valorable)
Habilidades analíticas y capacidad para interpretar datos.
Autonomía, proactividad y trabajo en equipo


Información adicional



Como empresa inclusiva, Veolia está comprometida con la diversidad y valora todas las solicitudes sin discriminación.

Title: Customer Service Data Analyst
Description:
As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We are now looking for a technical Business Analyst for Customer Support. The Customer Support area has been transformative during the pandemic. During the last year it has been transformed from a supporting department to a key differentiator against the competition. We have developed some features that revolutionized the way people manage their bookings and made travelling more flexible from a consumer point of view.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

20 million customers – 44 markets – 5 brands – 5.4M members in Prime

16.2 million bookings FY23 - More than 50,000 bookings per day - 100 million daily user searches

1400 employees – More than 50 different nationalities - 99% permanent contracts - 36.3 average age

We're a leading travel tech company, revolutionising the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What you will do:

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. As a Customer Service Data Analyst you will be in charge of:


Responsible for execution of key analysis, being the data entry point for the business team and including taking ownership of the different data sources from the business side. Understand the business needs, gather the data and present the key insights: “Contribute to the Customer Support strategic roadmap with numbers”
Analyze Data from the whole area, we serve both the Product area as well as all our centers. This means you’ll be answering questions like how can we best utilize our VIP agents as well as going into depth about how we can improve our chatbot
Elaborate business cases to support strategic product decisions: e.g. should we train more agents? what is the next feature we should develop? should we double down on our efforts and redirect more customers to the chat bot ?
Create dashboards and tracking: master the internal Business Intelligence tools to contribute to the monitoring and tracking of our business KPIs. Work with data engineering and data science teams to be able to leverage all our internal data
Contribute to the delivery of Customer Service strategic projects: participate in the delivery of the key internal projects, giving support from the business side to ensure progress and effective delivery of the desired outcomes. Work together with product and call centers in the execution of the projects, giving support from the analytical and business side



What you need to succeed:

Good to have

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team. Here's what you need to succeed:


Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, etc.),
2-4 years experience in a role with strong analytical component
Strong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data; python programming skills and experience with Google DataStudio will be highly valued
Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with the Google toolset (spreadsheets, google docs, etc)
Strong analytical skills, fast-learner, with high attention to detail and focused on results and productivity
A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys to have fun!
Business Proficiency in English



What’s in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture.

Here's what we offer:


A rewarding Compensation package! 💥 Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! 📚 Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! 🚀 Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! 💙 At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! 🎉 Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! 💫 Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.



Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

HTML:
As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We are now looking for a technical Business Analyst for Customer Support. The Customer Support area has been transformative during the pandemic. During the last year it has been transformed from a supporting department to a key differentiator against the competition. We have developed some features that revolutionized the way people manage their bookings and made travelling more flexible from a consumer point of view.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

20 million customers – 44 markets – 5 brands – 5.4M members in Prime

16.2 million bookings FY23 - More than 50,000 bookings per day - 100 million daily user searches

1400 employees – More than 50 different nationalities - 99% permanent contracts - 36.3 average age

We're a leading travel tech company, revolutionising the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What you will do:

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. As a Customer Service Data Analyst you will be in charge of:

  • Responsible for execution of key analysis, being the data entry point for the business team and including taking ownership of the different data sources from the business side. Understand the business needs, gather the data and present the key insights: “Contribute to the Customer Support strategic roadmap with numbers”
  • Analyze Data from the whole area, we serve both the Product area as well as all our centers. This means you’ll be answering questions like how can we best utilize our VIP agents as well as going into depth about how we can improve our chatbot
  • Elaborate business cases to support strategic product decisions: e.g. should we train more agents? what is the next feature we should develop? should we double down on our efforts and redirect more customers to the chat bot ?
  • Create dashboards and tracking: master the internal Business Intelligence tools to contribute to the monitoring and tracking of our business KPIs. Work with data engineering and data science teams to be able to leverage all our internal data
  • Contribute to the delivery of Customer Service strategic projects: participate in the delivery of the key internal projects, giving support from the business side to ensure progress and effective delivery of the desired outcomes. Work together with product and call centers in the execution of the projects, giving support from the analytical and business side


What you need to succeed:

Good to have

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team. Here's what you need to succeed:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, etc.),
  • 2-4 years experience in a role with strong analytical component
  • Strong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data; python programming skills and experience with Google DataStudio will be highly valued
  • Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with the Google toolset (spreadsheets, google docs, etc)
  • Strong analytical skills, fast-learner, with high attention to detail and focused on results and productivity
  • A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys to have fun!
  • Business Proficiency in English


What’s in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture.

Here's what we offer:

  • A rewarding Compensation package! 💥 Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
  • Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! 📚 Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
  • Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! 🚀 Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
  • Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! 💙 At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
  • Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! 🎉 Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
  • Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! 💫 Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.

Title: Data Analyst - Account Management Operations (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

In this role you will be part of the Account Management Team at Glovo Headquarters, that is focused on growing and retaining Glovo partners. You will be directly responsible for overseeing, challenging and rethinking the processes, data & tools of the post-sales operational landscape, based on solid data driven conclusions, so that they can be implemented on a global scale.

THE JOURNEY


Stakeholder management: Partner closely with senior sales leaders and cross functional partners to align on strategy
Communication: find simple ways to convey insights and recommendations from sophisticated analysis results to business leaders.
Data Analysis: Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to interpret complex datasets; Analyze and report weekly and monthly metrics to identify trends and stop opportunities for improvement.
Process Optimization: leverage critical thinking skills to analyze Account Management processes and lead the implementation of optimization strategies to drive efficiency and effectiveness in sales operations.
Automation: Design and implement automation solutions to remove manual processes.
Planning: Partner with Account Management leadership to set performance targets for local teams, recommend actions for improvement and work together to integrate positive changes within the operational environment.
Forecast: provide analytical and operational support to continuously improve our forecasting, pipeline management, and methodologies and processes.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Bachelor or equivalent in Business Administration, Economics, Mathematics, Finance, Accounting
4+ years of work experience with 2+ years in Sales Operations, preferably in a fast-growing B2B environment.
Technical and Proficient in data. Analyzing data sets with SQL queries, or crafting models and prototype tools, data is a core part of your toolkit.
Experience with BI tools and data visualization like Tableau, Power BI or Looker.
Experience with Salesforce.
Experience in complex problem solving, and working in a fast paced environment.
Demonstrated ability in critical thinking and process optimization, with a proven track of identifying inefficiencies and implementing solutions to enhance business operations.
Verbal and written communication skills. Strong consensus building and executive presence to communicate and defend plans.


Nice to have


Experience with Python or R is a strong plus.
Experience with forecasting and target setting, using data to establish future goals.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Customer Lifecycle & Growth
Description:
At Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.

We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That’s why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.




Meet the team!

At Preply, we're growing a talented Data Team to empower top-notch decision-making across our organization. Our team collaborates closely with various other chapters - including product, business, and platform - leveraging analysis, experimentation, causal inference, and machine learning.

As a key player, you’ll be embedded in cross-functional teams, partnering with Product Managers, Marketing, Tech Leads, and the Data Strategy team. Check out our Tech Radar to see the tools and technologies we love using at Preply!




What You’ll Be Doing

Develop and implement data frameworks to enhance our organic growth strategies, including SEO, CRM, and Referral programs
Drive virality and word-of-mouth growth by analyzing user behavior and helping teams capitalize opportunities where we have high user engagement
Generate strategic insights to shape top-level roadmaps.
Collaborate with teams to define KPIs for organic growth and maintain dashboards to monitor performance.
Identify trends and opportunities, providing actionable insights to support team initiatives.
Examples of areas you will cover are:
Collect, organize and interpret, utilizing statistical and analytical techniques, trends, patterns, and correlations from large SEO data sets (internal and external data)
Analyze cross-channel data, particularly in SEO and SEM, to optimize marketing efficiency and prevent cannibalization.




What You Need To Succeed

3-5 years' experience in Data Science/Analysis, focusing on data analytics for business growth strategy;
Previous experience in fast-paced Technology or Management Consulting companies;
Proven ability to work with product teams, run experiments, and identify product optimization opportunities;
Strong background in quantitative fields (e.g., statistics, mathematics);
Proficient coding skills in SQL;
An outcome-driven approach with a passion for problem-solving and exploring new ideas.
A creative mindset with a proactive attitude, along with stakeholder management and influencing skills;
Fluency in English and eager to work on a global product with a multicultural team.




Nice To Have

Experience with CRM tools (e.g., Braze) and referral programs;
Knowledge of SEO and third-party tools (e.g., Google Search Console, Ahrefs, Adwords);
Familiarity with predictive modeling;
Experience in digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C);
Knowledge of Looker, Amplitude, Snowflake, and growth/retention analytics frameworks.




Why You’ll Love It At Preply

An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
Not in Barcelona? We offer an attractive relocation package to join us in our Preply Barcelona Hub
Access to free mental health support platforms;
Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;
The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).




Our Principles

Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don’t fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.




Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

Title: Finance Reporting Data Analyst - SQL Advanced - (100% remote-friendly within Spain)
Description:
We are the largest digital healthcare platform in the world, present in 15 countries and currently connecting over 30 million patients to more than 2 million healthcare professionals. We seek to make the experience in health more human and we live and breath this mission.


We obsess over the challenge of minimizing patients' pain and helping healthcare professionals thrive managing their patients and expand their online presence. Through services that bring health to users, we provide a space for questions, opinions and a way to find the health professional that best fits your needs.


To deliver the best result, we have motivated people with an innovative spirit, giving everyone the opportunity to actively contribute and grow within the company. The DocPlanner team is our secret sauce and for the 2nd consecutive year we were recognized as a Great Place To Work. We love diversity because each unique individual's perspective makes us stronger. We encourage everyone to participate in our hiring process. We’d love for you to bring your unique skill set and join the team!




Job Description



The resource, working within the Financial Reporting team, will play a key role in supporting the evolution of financial reporting in a challenging and stimulating environment. You will help bridge the gap between finance and BI. Our primary objective is to assist the business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing reports as the primary and most reliable source of information.


A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.


You will be an integral part of the Financial Reporting team, working closely with the Data Analytics team to support business decisions based on data.

How would you be impacting our mission


Financial Reporting and Analysis:
Track key financial metrics and KPIs, ensuring they align with organizational goals;
Develop and maintain comprehensive financial dashboards using advanced BI tools;
Provide detailed insights into financial performance, trends, and variances;
Provide insights for long-term strategic decisions;
Data Management and Integration:
Ensure accurate and timely collection of financial data from systems like Oracle NetSuite;
Integrate data from multiple sources for a unified financial view;
Performance Measurement:
Analyze profitability and cost efficiency to identify improvement areas;
Regulatory and Compliance Reporting:
Support audits and for regulatory documentation;
Automation and Process Improvement:
Automate repetitive financial tasks to improve efficiency;
Implement process improvements to reduce manual efforts and errors;
Enhanced Reporting and Visualization:
Utilize BI tools like Tableau for dynamic, interactive reports and dashboards;
Enhance report quality and accessibility beyond traditional spreadsheets.


Qualifications



What will help you thrive?


Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
Strong written and oral communication skills in English; proficiency in other languages such as German, Spanish, and Italian is a plus.
Ability to gather, organize, analyze, and report large volumes of financial data with speed and accuracy.
Strong attention to detail with the ability to provide high-quality work efficiently.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to adapt and work in a quickly changing environment, managing competing demands.

Which skills are ‘bonus points’?


Master's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
Open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
Like to see the instant effects of your work.
Knowledge of ERP finance applications (Oracle, Oracle - NetSuite, SAP).
Relevant experience in accounting and financial reporting.


Additional Information



What will you get in return?


Let’s talk money


Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
Share options plan after 6 months of working with us

True flexibility and work-life balance


Remote first in one of our legal entities or hybrid work model in one of our office locations;
Flexible working hours;
Paid time off according to your location of work;
Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).

Health comes first


Health insurance according to your location of work:
Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.

What does the recruitment process look like?


A 30-minute meeting with Ro - Head of International Talent Acquisition
SHL test
A 45-minute meeting with Nicolò Truffa - Head of Financial reporting
A 60-minute meeting Wiktor Kulikowski - Business Intelligence Manager including the live SQL testing
Business Case - Prepare a Business Case
Present it within the with Nico and Wiktor for 90 minutes
Meet the Team for 15 minute meeting

Please submit your CV exclusively in English.


We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you’re reading, there’s a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we’re lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you’ve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.


“We believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.” Mariusz Gralewski, CEO

HTML:
We are the largest digital healthcare platform in the world, present in 15 countries and currently connecting over 30 million patients to more than 2 million healthcare professionals. We seek to make the experience in health more human and we live and breath this mission.

We obsess over the challenge of minimizing patients' pain and helping healthcare professionals thrive managing their patients and expand their online presence. Through services that bring health to users, we provide a space for questions, opinions and a way to find the health professional that best fits your needs.

To deliver the best result, we have motivated people with an innovative spirit, giving everyone the opportunity to actively contribute and grow within the company. The DocPlanner team is our secret sauce and for the 2nd consecutive year we were recognized as a Great Place To Work. We love diversity because each unique individual's perspective makes us stronger. We encourage everyone to participate in our hiring process. We’d love for you to bring your unique skill set and join the team!


Job Description

The resource, working within the Financial Reporting team, will play a key role in supporting the evolution of financial reporting in a challenging and stimulating environment. You will help bridge the gap between finance and BI. Our primary objective is to assist the business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing reports as the primary and most reliable source of information.

A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.

You will be an integral part of the Financial Reporting team, working closely with the Data Analytics team to support business decisions based on data.

How would you be impacting our mission

  • Financial Reporting and Analysis:
    • Track key financial metrics and KPIs, ensuring they align with organizational goals;
    • Develop and maintain comprehensive financial dashboards using advanced BI tools;
    • Provide detailed insights into financial performance, trends, and variances;
    • Provide insights for long-term strategic decisions;
  • Data Management and Integration:
    • Ensure accurate and timely collection of financial data from systems like Oracle NetSuite;
    • Integrate data from multiple sources for a unified financial view;
  • Performance Measurement:
    • Analyze profitability and cost efficiency to identify improvement areas;
  • Regulatory and Compliance Reporting:
    • Support audits and for regulatory documentation;
  • Automation and Process Improvement:
    • Automate repetitive financial tasks to improve efficiency;
    • Implement process improvements to reduce manual efforts and errors;
  • Enhanced Reporting and Visualization:
    • Utilize BI tools like Tableau for dynamic, interactive reports and dashboards;
    • Enhance report quality and accessibility beyond traditional spreadsheets.

Qualifications

What will help you thrive?

  • Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
  • Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
  • Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
  • Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
  • Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
  • Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills in English; proficiency in other languages such as German, Spanish, and Italian is a plus.
  • Ability to gather, organize, analyze, and report large volumes of financial data with speed and accuracy.
  • Strong attention to detail with the ability to provide high-quality work efficiently.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to adapt and work in a quickly changing environment, managing competing demands.

Which skills are ‘bonus points’?

  • Master's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
  • Able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
  • Open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
  • Like to see the instant effects of your work.
  • Knowledge of ERP finance applications (Oracle, Oracle - NetSuite, SAP).
  • Relevant experience in accounting and financial reporting.

Additional Information

What will you get in return?

Let’s talk money

  • Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
  • Share options plan after 6 months of working with us

True flexibility and work-life balance

  • Remote first in one of our legal entities or hybrid work model in one of our office locations;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Paid time off according to your location of work;
  • Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).

Health comes first

  • Health insurance according to your location of work:
  • Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.

What does the recruitment process look like?

  • A 30-minute meeting with Ro - Head of International Talent Acquisition
  • SHL test
  • A 45-minute meeting with Nicolò Truffa - Head of Financial reporting
  • A 60-minute meeting Wiktor Kulikowski - Business Intelligence Manager including the live SQL testing
  • Business Case - Prepare a Business Case
  • Present it within the with Nico and Wiktor for 90 minutes
  • Meet the Team for 15 minute meeting

Please submit your CV exclusively in English.

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you’re reading, there’s a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we’re lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you’ve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.

Title: Big Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Media help partners understand the changing advertising landscape. Specialising in audience measurement, consumer targeting and in-depth intelligence into paid, owned and earned media, their global coverage and local expertise enable better understanding of media audiences and their relationships with brands.

Kantar Media is a wholly owned but operationally independent part of the Kantar Group.

Job Details

Kantar es la empresa líder mundial en datos, información y consultoría. Entendemos mejor que nadie cómo piensa, siente, compra, comparte, vota y ve la gente. Combinando nuestra experiencia en la comprensión humana con las tecnologías avanzadas, las 30.000 personas de Kantar ayudan a las principales organizaciones del mundo a tener éxito y a crecer.

La Division de Media es experta en comprender el cambiante panorama de los medios de comunicación. Esto incluye la medición de la audiencia de TV así como la segmentación del consumidor. Su cobertura global y su experiencia local permiten a los clientes comprender mejor las audiencias de los medios y sus relaciones con las marcas para optimizar la inversión.

En Media Division estamos buscando un perfil de Big Data Executive con interés por los estudios de mercado para incorporarse al equipo de Data Science de nuestra división de Audiencias de TV.

Las Funciones Serán Las Siguientes


Programación
Programar rutinas en lenguajes de programación como SAS, SQL, Python, R, etc.
Definir KPIs que sean relevantes, entendibles y enfocados a los objetivos.
Analizar e interpretar resultados.
Conocimiento de fuentes
Conocimiento de definición del panel: variables de equilibraje, referenciales…
Conocimiento de los diferentes sistemas de medición: Audio Matching, Focal Meter, RPD…
Conocimiento de fuentes estadísticas: INE, EGM
Elaboración de Presentaciones
Elaboración de PPT para clientes con nuevas funcionalidades de la Muestra
Asistir y dar soporte estadístico a las reuniones con clientes.
Visión global de la operación de audimetría y conocimiento pormenorizado de todos sus conceptos.
Automatización
Automatizar procesos rutinarios para que sean seguros y más eficientes
Desarrollo de nuevos productos.


Perfil


Formación de Grado/Master en Data Science, Estadística, Matemáticas o Informática
Conocimientos avanzados de SQL
Conocimientos avanzados de Python.
Valorable PowerBI, Google Cloud Plattform, R y SAS


Country

Spain

Why join Kantar?

We pride ourselves on understanding people, and what makes us think and act the way we do.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.


Show more

Title: Analista de Datos del Mundo Real (RWD)
Description:
Dentro de Capgemini Engineering, Hybrid Intelligence es el equipo internacional de expertos en datos e IA y nuestro trabajo es fusionar las matemáticas aplicadas, computación científica, inteligencia artificial e ingeniería de software.

Somos responsables de aplicar la ciencia de datos y las tecnologías de aprendizaje automático en nuestros proyectos para diferentes industrias como: Aeroespacial, Automoción, Life & Sciences, Ingeniería, Industrial, Oil & Gas, entre otras.

Te Encargarás De


Recopilar, gestionar y analizar datos del mundo real (RWD)
Desarrollar Modelos predictivos y descriptivos aplicando técnicas de Machine Learning y estadística avanzada.
Integra y armonizar fuentes de datos heterogéneas para generar insights.
Aplicar metodologías de análisis de datos para extraer patrones significativos que apoyen la toma de decisiones.
Colaborar con equipos multifuncionales, asegurando la correcta implementación y despliegue de soluciones basadas en datos.
Contribuir al desarrollo de intraestructuras de datos robustas y garantizar la calidad y validez de los datos.


Eres La Persona Que Buscamos Si


Eres Graduado en Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Física o similar
Tienes experiencia como Analista de Datos, con fuerte manejo de datos del mundo real (RWD)
Estás familiarizado con técnicas de Machine Learning.
Tienes un nivel alto de inglés


Te Ofrecemos


Formar parte de la Comunidad Internacional DATA & AI.
Tickets restaurante
Formación continua. Podrás disfrutar de Mylearning y Capgemini University, con acceso a plataformas como: Coursera, Udemy, Pluralsight, Harvard Manager Mentor, entre otras.
Plan de Certificación
Acceso a formación lingüística en inglés, francés y alemán con Education First (EF).
Seguro de vida y accidentes.
Ayuda guardería para el cuidado de niños de 0 a 3 años.
Plan de Retribución Flexible (seguro médico, guardería, transporte, formación).
Ofertas y descuentos para empleados en diferentes productos y servicios.


¿Por qué Capgemini?


Somos TOP EMPLOYERS y líderes mundiales en Ingeniería.
Trabajamos en proyectos relevantes en innovación e I+D
Estamos comprometidos con la igualdad de oportunidades.
Tenemos experiencia multisectorial y multidisciplinar.
Participamos en comunidades tecnológicas con un enfoque de aprendizaje y mejora continua.


La diversidad es clave en nuestra estrategia

Nuestro compromiso con la inclusión y la igualdad de oportunidades se traduce en un Plan de Igualdad y un Código Ético que garantizan el desarrollo profesional de nuestra plantilla y la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección dentro de un entorno libre de discriminación por motivos de etnia, nacionalidad, origen social, edad, orientación sexual, expresión de género, religión o cualquier otra circunstancia personal, física o social.

En Capgemini Engineering valoramos todas las candidaturas, ¡no dudes en presentar tu candidatura!

Title: Data Analyst (Retention Analytics Team)
Description:
Job Description

Hi there!

We are Semrush, a global IT company developing our own product – a platform for digital marketers. New stars are born here, so don’t miss your chance. This is our Data Analyst role for those who strive to implement functional processes and drive them to full completion.

We are seeking a Data Analyst with a h2 focus on Data Analysis and Business Intelligence (BI) to join our Retention division. The ideal candidate will support the development, implementation, and deployment of analytics on customer and product data, delivering actionable insights to drive business decisions. A basic understanding of Data Science principles will be beneficial in enhancing the analytical capabilities of our team.

Tasks in the role


Data Analysis & Reporting:
Conduct in-depth analysis of product insights and customer behavior to identify data-driven opportunities for improving customer retention and fostering profitable growth.
Analyze and report on data patterns and customer pain points using various data sources, including structured and unstructured data, benchmarks, and operational metrics.
Create meaningful reports and insights to support hypotheses, driving testing and experimentation.
Provide ad-hoc analysis and reporting to meet the evolving needs of the Retention division.

Business Intelligence:
Design and develop dashboards and reports in BI tools like Tableau or PowerBI, ensuring they are user-friendly and aligned with UI/UX best practices.
Create and maintain reporting specifications for new reports/dashboards and perform testing/validation to ensure data integrity, accessibility, and accuracy.
Consult with Retention division staff to identify new business reporting needs and provide guidance on complex data environments.

Data Systems & Documentation:
Document data analysis efforts, including data sources, reporting specifications, and issue/problem resolutions.
Ensure proper documentation of reporting and analytical tools for future reference and continuity.



Requirements

Who we are looking for

Technical Skills:


Strong experience in SQL and database design.
Proficiency in designing dashboards and reports in BI tools such as Tableau or PowerBI.
Basic knowledge of data science principles, with the ability to apply them to drive actionable insights.
Experience with cloud platforms and cloud storage solutions is a plus.
Understanding of data extraction using API calls.
Professional Skills:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex data clearly and concisely.
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.



Not required, but a plus


2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field
Familiarity with cloud platforms, particularly GCP, is an advantage
Basic programming skills in Python or R for data manipulation and analysis
You share our common values: Trust, because we prefer to speak up and be our true selves; Sense of Ownership, because it’s not worth wasting time on something you don’t believe in; and enthusiasm for Constant Changes, because we are always looking to make things better



A Bit About The Team

You can get to know the team better at one of the interviews, but some brief information about future colleagues will be useful now.

Our team is a dynamic mix of analysts and engineers who collaborate on a wide range of analytics projects, including data analysis, dashboard development, model building, and A/B testing across various domains. We work closely with the Retention division, delivering actionable insights and helping to drive data-driven decisions. What sets us apart is our chill, supportive vibe and a deep belief in success through collaboration. We prioritize teamwork, knowledge sharing, and continuous learning. Everyone’s contributions are valued, and we work together to solve complex problems while keeping the atmosphere positive and fun. If you enjoy a collaborative environment where innovation is encouraged and teamwork drives success, you’ll fit right in!

We will try to create all the right conditions for you to work and rest comfortably


This offer stands for the “hybrid” work format: some days, you work from the office, and some #wfh. Trust us, it’s an efficient way of work. Proven!
Flexible working day start
Unlimited PTO
Hobby benefit
Breakfast, snacks, and coffee at the office
Corporate events
Training, courses, conferences
Gifts for employees



Finally, a Little More About Our Company

Semrush is a leading online visibility management SaaS platform that enables businesses globally to run search engine optimization, pay-per-click, content, social media and competitive research campaigns and get measurable results from online marketing.

We’ve been developing our product for 16 years and have been awarded G2s Top 100 Software Products, Global and US Search Awards 2021, Great Place to Work Certification, Deloitte Technology Fast 500 and many more. In March 2021 Semrush went public and started trading on the NYSE with the SEMR ticker.

10,000,000+ users in America, Europe, Asia, and Australia have already tried Semrush, and over 1,000 people around the world are working on its development. The Semrush team is constantly growing.

Semrush is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or medical condition including medical characteristics, genetic identity, marital status, military service, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state or federal laws. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications.

We’ve been developing our product for 16 years and have been awarded G2s Top 100 Software Products, Global and US Search Awards 2021, Great Place to Work Certification, Deloitte Technology Fast 500 and many more. In March 2021 Semrush went public and started trading on the NYSE with the SEMR ticker.

10,000,000+ users in America, Europe, Asia, and Australia have already tried Semrush, and over 1,000 people around the world are working on its development. The Semrush team is constantly growing.

Semrush is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or medical condition including medical characteristics, genetic identity, marital status, military service, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state or federal laws. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications.

Title: Analista Business Intelligence
Description:
¿Tienes experiencia trabajando en equipos de data engineering y estás buscando un proyecto desafiante en el sector energético?




¡Esta es tu oportunidad! En Grupo NeoElectra, líder en el sector energético y en plena expansión, buscamos un Analista Business Intelligence para nuestras oficinas en Sant Just Desvern (Barcelona).




Si eres una persona resolutiva, motivada y con ganas de crecer profesionalmente en un entorno dinámico, ¡te invitamos a seguir leyendo!




Responsabilidades:




Diseñar, documentar, implementar y desarrollar el datawarehouse de la compañía (desarrollo SQL y Power BI): Implementar procesos ETL para la carga de datos en el datawarehouse conectando con las diferentes fuentes de información (ERP, API's, CRM, archivos .xlsx, .csv etc), limpieza y transformación de datos, etc
Integrar y automatizar la extracción de fuentes de datos internas y externas en la base de datos (ETL) administrando la estructura de datos (control de acceso, mantenimiento, monitorización).
Automatizar procesos de reporte y mejorar la eficiencia de los flujos de trabajo con una mejora continua, propuesta de nuevas implementaciones y soluciones.
Colaborar con diferentes equipos para comprender y/o descubrir necesidades, traducirlas en requisitos funcionales y brindar soluciones BI.
Crear tableros interactivos personalizados para el usuario final para facilitar la consulta y visualización de datos.
Capacitar a los usuarios finales.
Garantizar la integridad y precisión de los datos.




Requisitos:




Ingeniería/ /Matemáticas o máster en ingeniería de datos o data science, o cursos certificados en estos campos.
Programación y gestión de bases de datos (Power BI)
Implementación de soluciones óptimas para la gestión, digitalización y análisis de información
Experiencia trabajando en equipos de data engineering preferiblemente en entornos de datawarehouse en la nube.
Conocimientos/experiencia en lenguajes de programación SQL y Python
Conocimiento de modelado de datos dimensional.
Experiencia previa o conocimiento de Power BI
Familiaridad con el entorno Azure o certificaciones DP-203 o DP-500.




Ofrecemos:




Contrato indefinido.
Formato laboral híbrido, con opción de teletrabajar los viernes.
Horario de lunes a jueves 10:00-17:00 y viernes de 8:00h -15:00h.
Un excelente ambiente de trabajo, donde se valora el desarrollo profesional y personal.
La posibilidad de formar parte de una compañía en pleno proceso de expansión




¡Si te apasiona el sector energético y quieres ser parte de un equipo innovador ¡esperamos tu candidatura!




Únete a Grupo NeoElectra y contribuye con tu talento al éxito y crecimiento de nuestra empresa.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Lo Que Ofrecemos

Your mission:

As a Data Analyst for KION ITS (Industrial Trucks & Services) Production and Order Processing (Inventory) Data, you will extract and analyze data from diverse data sources and systems to successfully implement new pricing strategies and processes.

You will translate commercial operations demands into technical requirements, architecture concepts and interface definitions, finding clever, automated and intelligent solutions and implement those in an independent manner.

Tareas y Cualificaciones

Your profile:


Completed studies in computer science, (business) information systems, (business) mathematics or a comparable education.
Experience in translate business needs into technical specifications and preparing clean and structured data models.
Experience in working with modern data infrastructures und data integration processes.
Used to collaborate closely in interdisciplinary teams with business stakeholders, product managers, data analysts among others.
Experience working with technologies like SAP, SAP Business Warehouse, Power BI, Python, Azure, Dataverse and SQL-based databases.
High degree of initiative and solution orientation
Fluent in English, German is a plus.
Show more
HTML:
Lo Que Ofrecemos

Your mission:

As a Data Analyst for KION ITS (Industrial Trucks & Services) Production and Order Processing (Inventory) Data, you will extract and analyze data from diverse data sources and systems to successfully implement new pricing strategies and processes.

You will translate commercial operations demands into technical requirements, architecture concepts and interface definitions, finding clever, automated and intelligent solutions and implement those in an independent manner.

Tareas y Cualificaciones

Your profile:

  • Completed studies in computer science, (business) information systems, (business) mathematics or a comparable education.
  • Experience in translate business needs into technical specifications and preparing clean and structured data models.
  • Experience in working with modern data infrastructures und data integration processes.
  • Used to collaborate closely in interdisciplinary teams with business stakeholders, product managers, data analysts among others.
  • Experience working with technologies like SAP, SAP Business Warehouse, Power BI, Python, Azure, Dataverse and SQL-based databases.
  • High degree of initiative and solution orientation
  • Fluent in English, German is a plus.

Title: BI Specialist
Description:
Our Manifesto

At Heura we are food activists, and our mission is to provide a solution that leaves animals out of the equation, while feeding millions of people in a sustainable way. Technology gives us the opportunity to build a food system that not only solves our current challenges but also responds to our values.

We also know that great goals can only be achieved by diverse teams of people with different backgrounds, perspectives, orientations, abilities, food tastes, dress sense, and time zones - we don't just accept our differences; we fully support and celebrate them.

But ultimately, we all have one common goal: accelerating the protein transition.

And that’s why we are looking for a BI Specialist! To join the Good Rebels team and help us achieve our mission through facilitating informed and strategic decision making through the analysis and visualization of business-relevant data.

Your Challenge


Business Requirements Analysis: Collaborate with different departments to understand their needs and translate them into technical requirements. Identify key areas for improvement and optimization opportunities through data analysis.
Dashboard Design and Development: Create interactive and visually appealing dashboards to facilitate decision-making. Ensure dashboards are intuitive, easy to use, and tailored to end-users. Utilize data visualization tools such as Power BI.
Data Extraction and Transformation: Obtain data from various sources (databases, ERP systems, CRM systems, etc.) and transform it into usable information. Design and maintain ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure data quality and consistency.
Data Analysis: Perform complex data analyses to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies. Generate ad hoc reports to answer specific business questions.
Data Management: Ensure the integrity, accuracy, and security of the data. Implement and maintain an efficient and scalable data model.
User Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users to help them effectively use the dashboards. Create documentation and user guides for the developed tools and dashboards.
Continuous Improvement: Monitor dashboard performance and make adjustments as needed. Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in BI to continuously improve offered solutions.
Communication and Collaboration: Act as a liaison between the IT department and business areas to ensure alignment of technological and business objectives. Facilitate meetings and presentations to communicate findings and recommend actions based on data analysis.
BI Strategy Development: Contribute to the development and implementation of the company's BI strategy. Ensure BI solutions are aligned with the organization's strategic objectives.
Process Automation: Identify and automate repetitive processes to improve operational efficiency. Implement automatic alerts and notifications based on critical business data.
Power BI ownership: from modelling, data sources, metric calculation, visualizations, service, effective distribution and security access



YOU WILL FEEL COMFORTABLE, ENJOY AND DO GREAT AT THIS ROLE IF YOU HAVE:


A Caring attitude towards our mission and see it as a “personal” problem to be solved professionally.
Desire to help, assist and solve people's needs with a GoodVibes attitude.
Passion for the business and a deep understanding of it to make sure your job at this role is aligned to business needs and goals.
Previous experience in similar roles, ideally at an FMCG company or a high-growth startup.
Computer engineering, computer CFGS or similar. Ideal Power BI Certification.
Proficiency with Microsoft Power BI (Desktop application and the Service, and Gateway). Any other similar BI tool such as Tableau, SAS, Qlik, Sisense, Oracle Analytics Cloud, MicroStrategy or Microsoft Excel would be beneficial.
Be familiar with data sources, data warehouses, data models, data quality, data visualization and data security.
Be able to use SQL, Python, R or other programming languages to manipulate and analyze data.
Be aware of the latest trends and innovations in BI, such as cloud computing, artificial intelligence and big data.
Excel skills with Power Query and Data Modelling
Underlying awareness of SQL Server, or any other Database Management systems
Knowledge of SAP solutions
An analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving mindset to approach everyday challenges.
Ability to prioritize and anticipate opportunities
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both English (mandatory) and Spanish.
Ability to create strong and trustful relationships with internal and external stakeholders.



Heura Life Benefits

To make this world a better place is hard work, so we support our Dream Team with:


Culture of freedom, responsibility, and constructive feedback
An entrepreneurial environment that encourages innovation
Regulatory local labour days + 5 extra ones for Vacations! (capped in 30 labour days yearly)
Flexible working environment
Private Health Insurance or Medical Allowance
Organic coffee, tea & plant-based drinks (in local offices)
Discounted gym memberships
Discounts on Heura’s products
Flexible retribution (in Spain)
After-work gatherings and other cool company events (in local offices)
and…



… Working with top-talented and amazing Good Rebels! 👇🏽

We care deeply, which leads us to have a genuine curiosity to understand the core of challenges and get the right diagnosis in order to recognize what will have the most impact.

We find the best hacker solution to each challenge; if it exists, we go for it, if not, we enjoy creating it. We ensure the structures we build are the most efficient ones: we grow two trees from one seed.

We are also high achievers: we never give up. We are fully focused on generating scalable impact taking end-to-end accountability.

None of this would make sense if we didn’t enjoy the journey. We smile and celebrate every day because we are passionate about our work and our mission.

If you see yourself here and can meet the essential requirements, we would love for you to apply. Or, do you know someone who would be a perfect fit? Let them know!

Our mission is to build a net-positive food system by accelerating the protein transition with the ambition of not just being an alternative to current problems but successors by creating value chains that integrate what matters and empowering people to be part of this change.

🌿💛

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
BUSCAMOS CONSULTORES SENIOR #ANALYTICS




para unirse a nuestro equipo de alto rendimiento de Data Analyst en #Becomit

Estamos buscando un #Arquitecto de #datos con amplia experiencia en la suite de analítica de datos de #Microsoft .

Nos ayudará a : #Diseñar e #implementar soluciones de datos principalmente en la suite de #Microsoft, incluyendo #Data Warehouses, #Data Marts, #Data Lakes, procesos de carga.

Trabajará con clientes y equipos internos para definir y comprender los requisitos de datos y de negocio, y proporcionar recomendaciones de diseño para soluciones eficientes y efectivas.

Creará #modelos de datos, #esquemas de bases de datos y documentación técnica relacionada.

Colaborará con equipos de desarrollo de #software y de #infraestructura para implementar soluciones escalables y seguras.

#Realizará análisis de datos y proporcionar información y conocimientos técnicos para ayudar a los equipos de toma de decisiones en el negocio.

Evaluará e investigará nuevas tecnologías y herramientas para la integración en soluciones de datos existentes.

Requisitos:

Mínimo de 5 años de experiencia en diseño e implementación de soluciones de datos.

Experiencia en plataforma Microsoft (#SQL Server, #SSIS, #SSAS, #Power BI y #Azure).

Amplio conocimiento de lenguaje #SQL tanto a nivel de consulta como de procesos.

Amplio conocimiento de conceptos de arquitectura de datos, modelado de datos y diseño de bases de datos.

Habilidades de liderazgo para liderar y guiar equipos en proyectos de datos complejos.

Fuertes habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas.

También se valorará:

Conocimientos en #AWS

Conocimientos en #Python

Conocimientos en #QlikSense o Tableau

Ofrecemos:

Contrato Indefinido
Modalidad #híbrido #teletrabajo
horarios intensivos todos los viernes y en períodos de vacaciones escolares para conciliación familiar
tu día de aniversario festivo
posibilidad de crecer en un equipo de alto rendimiento




Estaremos encantados de conocerte y unirte a nuestra #familiaBecomit

contacta con nosotros en : rrhh@becomit.com

Title: Data Analyst sector Automoción
Description:
CT es una empresa líder en tecnología, que proporciona servicios de innovación e ingeniería en los sectores aeronáutico, espacial, naval, automovilístico, ferroviario, energético y de plantas industriales. CT impulsa los límites de la tecnología a través de la innovación, y lleva la eficiencia a otro nivel cubriendo todo el ciclo de vida de los productos, desde el diseño y la fabricación hasta el soporte postventa. Con más de 30 años de experiencia, el éxito de CT está impulsado hoy en día por más de 1.800 ingenieros expertos repartidos en siete países, en tres continentes.

Actualmente Estamos Buscando Incorporar Ingeniero/as De Datos Para Diferentes Proyectos De Automoción En Las Empresas Más Importantes Del Sector En Barcelona, Para La Realización De Las Siguientes Tareas


Analizar datos de producción, calidad y rendimiento de vehículos para identificar mejoras operativas y optimizar procesos.
Crear informes y dashboards visuales para comunicar insights a equipos de ingeniería, manufactura y dirección.
Colaborar con diferentes departamentos para implementar soluciones basadas en datos que mejoren la eficiencia y la calidad del producto.
Formación en Ingeneria
Experiencia previa en automoción
Valorable experiencia en departamentos de I+D o departamento de test/validaciones.
Nivel de Ingés alto
Conocimientos en lenguajes de programación
Manejo de bases de datos
Conocimientos de IA, IoT y Big Data


¿Qué ofrecemos?


Modalidad de trabajo híbrida (3 días presenciales y 2 días de teletrabajo).
Horario de 08h a 17:30h, viernes media jornada.
Desarrollo profesional continuo.
Retribución competitiva.
Clima laboral participativo, inclusivo y dinámico. ¡Nos encanta trabajar en equipo!
Formar parte del lugar donde los ingenieros aman trabajar.


Buscamos una persona proactiva, motivada, con ganas de seguir creciendo en el mundo industrial, con ganas de nuevos retos dentro del mundo tecnológico.

Si te sientes identificado no dudes en aplicar!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Somos una de las entidades financieras de referencia de crédito al consumo en el mercado español. Con 30 años de historia en nuestro país, hemos acompañado a más de dos millones y medio de clientes para hacer realidad sus proyectos. Estamos respaldados por el grupo Crédit Mutuel, el cuarto banco más importante en Francia, y el holding Argosyn. Ambos nos proporcionan el soporte financiero y tecnológico necesario para diseñar, vender y gestionar una amplia gama de productos de crédito al consumo, préstamos personales, tarjetas, líneas de crédito, soluciones de pago y seguros.




Estamos buscando para nuestras oficinas ubicadas en Cornellà de Llobregat a un/a Business Intelligence Analyst.




Entre tus funciones y responsabilidades:




Reunión con usuarios para la toma de requerimientos con el fin de transformarlos en KPI's significativos que ayuden a monitorear e impulsar el negocio.
Revisión crítica, positiva y constructiva del ecosistema de informes que faciliten la lectura del dato (data visualization).
Proponer nuevas formas de evaluar la evolución de la actividad de la empresa y su impacto en cada eje.
Automatización de los procesos recurrentes solicitados por las Direcciones de cada servicio.
Sintetizar la información presentando resúmenes y gráficos críticos que aporten el dato más destacado.
Apoyo y comunicación con el área de arquitectura del dato ante nuevos datos solicitados por el usuario.
Participación en proyectos de la compañía.




¿Qué esperamos de ti?




Formación universitaria, preferentemente en Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería o similar. Valorable formación complementaria en Data Analytics.
Experiencia mínima de 4-5 años como BI Analyst / Data Analyst.
Conocimientos en herramientas de visualización de datos.
Conocimiento avanzado de SQL. Muy valorable SAS.
Persona proactiva con buenas habilidades comunicativas, gran capacidad para trabajar en equipo, asegurar la fiabilidad y rigor del dato.




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?




Contratación indefinida.
Formación continuada.
Posibilidades de desarrollo profesional.
Modelo Híbrido de trabajo (2 días desde casa, 3 en la oficina).
Salario fijo + variable y otros beneficios sociales (ticket restaurant,...).

Show more

Con 30 años de historia en nuestro país, hemos acompañado a más de dos millones y medio de clientes para hacer realidad sus proyectos. Estamos buscando para nuestras oficinas ubicadas en Cornellà de Llobregat a un/a Business Intelligence Analyst.


Entre tus funciones y responsabilidades:


  • Reunión con usuarios para la toma de requerimientos con el fin de transformarlos en KPI's significativos que ayuden a monitorear e impulsar el negocio.
  • Revisión crítica, positiva y constructiva del ecosistema de informes que faciliten la lectura del dato (data visualization).

  • Apoyo y comunicación con el área de arquitectura del dato ante nuevos datos solicitados por el usuario.
  • Participación en proyectos de la compañía.


¿Qué esperamos de ti?


  • Formación universitaria, preferentemente en Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería o similar. Valorable formación complementaria en Data Analytics.
  • Experiencia mínima de 4-5 años como BI Analyst / Data Analyst.
  • Conocimientos en herramientas de visualización de datos.
  • Conocimiento avanzado de SQL. Muy valorable SAS.
  • Persona proactiva con buenas habilidades comunicativas, gran capacidad para trabajar en equipo, asegurar la fiabilidad y rigor del dato.


¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?


  • Contratación indefinida.
  • Formación continuada.
  • Posibilidades de desarrollo profesional.
  • Modelo Híbrido de trabajo (2 días desde casa, 3 en la oficina).
  • Salario fijo + variable y otros beneficios sociales (ticket restaurant,...).

Title: Data Analytics
Description:
Who We Are

We simplify wealth creation. Founded in 2014 in Vienna, Austria by Eric Demuth, Paul Klanschek and Christian Trummer, we’re here to help people trust themselves enough to build their financial freedom — for now and the future. Our user-friendly, trade-everything platform empowers both first-time investors and seasoned experts to invest in the cryptocurrencies, crypto indices, stocks*, precious metals and commodities* they want — with any sized budget, 24/7. Our global team works across different cultures and time zones, bringing our products to more than 4 million customers, making us one of Europe’s safest and most secure platforms that powers modern investing.

Headquartered in Austria but operating across Europe, our products are built by fast-moving, talented, “roll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen” kind of people. It’s these diverse perspectives and innovative minds operating as ONE TEAM that keep Bitpanda at the cutting edge of our industry. So if you’re someone who thinks big, moves fast and wants to make an impact right from day one, then get ready to join our industry-changing team. Let’s go!

Your mission

Do you want to join a growing team of data enthusiasts who operate a modern data platform and build user-friendly data products? Are you passionate about enabling decision making and constantly learning with us? Then our Data Engineering team will be perfect for you!

What You’ll Do


Contribute to the ongoing design of our core data model to support advanced analytics and reporting.
Engage and collaborate with stakeholders to identify reporting needs/requirements and potential enhancements early on.
Ensure high data quality of the core data layer.
Enable analysts across the whole organisation.
Contribute to team strategy and roadmapping to align the team’s efforts with broader organisational goals.



Who You Are


Strong experience with SQL, Python and dbt - Airflow is a plus.
Hands-on experience with data-modelling
Understanding of different data-modelling concepts (dimensional modelling, OBT, …) and data quality
Willingness to learn and to grow with the team



What’s In It For You


Hybrid-working model with a 50/50 split between in-office and home, plus 60 Work From Anywhere days annually
Total compensation package including participation in our Bitpanda stock option plan
Competitive benefits programs and policies shaped by our flexibility-first philosophy
Exclusive premiums when trading on Bitpanda
Company-wide and team events — both in-person and virtually!
Bitpanda swag to keep you living the brand



And, above all, the opportunity to learn and grow as part of Bitpanda’s incredible journey towards being Europe’s future #1 investment platform.

Bitpanda is committed to fostering a fair and equal environment based on trust and mutual respect. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace is paramount to our success and we are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.
