Title: Data Analyst (Porto)
Description:
Descrição da Função

Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations. In this project you will be able to contact with one of the key players in banking in the EU and around the world. Thus, you will be part of a multicultural team that is spread across more than 50 countries and you will help develop solutions in one of these three areas: investments, business solutions or commercial/personal services. We are looking for a Data Analyst to work in this project in Porto. Requirements: - Solid knowledge and experience in reporting, and ETL development with Power BI and Alteryx; - Previous experience developing with SQL, and PL/SQL; - Knowledge of SAP Business Objects, Jaspersoft, VBA, API, Python and Tibco Spotfire is a significant plus; - Fluent in English. Responsibilities: - Responsible for analysis, developments, tests and integration of technologies to serve business intelligence projects; - Align application code to the best technical and methodological practices; - Coordination with Production teams to create self-service environments for Self Service projects and manage releases; - Ensure maintenance and level 3 support; - Experience in Agile context (like Kanban, Lean or SCRUM). We offer: - Health insurance; - A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary; - Constant feedback so you can grow professionally; - Remote onboarding process; - Team events every semester so you can live new adventures; - Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Localização


Porto, Portugal

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

€40,000 - €45,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

Porto (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (Power BI/Alteryx)
HTML:
Na WINNING CONSULTING procuramos umData Analystpara se juntar à nossa equipade consultorianum projeto na área da Banca, no Porto - Híbrido.

TAREFAS/FUNÇÕES

  • Responsável pela análise, desenvolvimento, testes e integração de tecnologias para servir projetos de Business Intelligence (BI & Analytics);
  • Alinhar o código das aplicações com as melhores práticas técnicas e metodológicas solicitadas;
  • Coordenação com as equipas de Produção para criação de ambientes self-service para projetos de self service e gestão de releases;
  • Assegurar a manutenção e o suporte de nível 3 do conjunto de aplicações;
  • Experiência em contexto Agile (como Kanban, Lean ou SCRUM)

REQUISITOS

  • Formação académica superior em Ciências da Computação, Engenharia Informática ou numa área relacionada;
  • Cerca de 3 anos de experiência como Data Analyst, com sólidos conhecimentos e experiência no desenvolvimento de relatórios e ETL com Power BI e Alteryx;
  • Competências de desenvolvimento SQL;
  • Competências de desenvolvimento PL/SQL;
  • Valorizam-se conhecimentos em SAP Business Objects, Jaspersoft, VBA, API, Python ouTibco Spotfire;
  • Idiomas:nível de Inglês avançado, conhecimentos de Francês (nice to have)

Quem Somos?

A Winning Consulting é uma empresa de consultoria que oferece serviços de consultadoria, formação, recrutamento e investigação. Apoiamos os nossos clientes na procura de soluções inovadoras e sustentáveis, desde a aplicação do conhecimento científico na resolução de problemas complexos de gestão até à transformação digital e tecnológica das organizações.

Se quiser saber mais sobre nós, visite o nosso websitehttps://www.winning-consulting.com/

Todas as candidaturas são tratadas com confidencialidade ao abrigo do RGPD.Ao subscreveres a tua candidatura, concordas com o tratamento da tua informação no âmbito do recrutamento e na tua inclusão na nossa base de dados de candidatos.Caso não dês consentimento para o tratamento destes dados, pedimos-te o favor de não te candidatares a este anúncio.

Title: Data Analyst (f/m/div)
HTML:
Become a strategic problem solver to develop data-driven solutions that meet business needs. Lead projects to deliver robust, sustainable solutions while independently shaping your analysis and presenting innovative ideas to diverse audiences. Build strong working relationships with key partners to drive business success. The role involves engaging with different stakeholders to identify strategic needs, work independently or collaboratively to develop data-driven solutions to meet business requirements. This includes leading projects to ensure the delivery of sustainable and scalable solutions, while also being self-directed in analyzing data and recommending innovative ideas for improvement. Additionally, it entails presenting to diverse organizational audiences and cultivating strong relationships with key business partners.

In your new role you will:

  • Understand the overall strategic requirements to inform your solutions;
  • Independently or working with a team to develop and deliver tools, data visualization and analysis to support the overall business;
  • Leading projects and tasks,ensuring the delivery of robust, sustainable and scalable solutions while engaging with IT and business partners;
  • Be self-directed in interrogating and understanding data to shape your analysis;
  • Recommend innovative ideas and procedures to improve existing strategies;
  • Present to audiences of varying organizational roles and hierarchy levels;
  • Develop solid working relationships with key partners across the business.

You are a results-driven professional with a Data Analysis background with an interest in Supply Chain processes. Also, you have solid communication skills and are able to build lasting relationships and to coordinate effectively with your colleagues. Your open-mindedness embraces new ideas and creative opportunities.

You are best equipped for this task if you have:

  • A Degree in IT, Data Analytics or similar;
  • At least 3 years of proven experience in Data Analysis. Background experience in a supply chain environment would be a plus;
  • Good understanding of Mathematics and Statistics, with an excellent Microsoft Excel (VBA) ability;
  • Previous experience in analytical roles using SQL, Python or similar;
  • Proven experience with Power BI and Tableau;
  • Knowledge of ERP would be a plus;
  • Highly organized, detail-oriented, a solid work ethic as well as demonstrated teamwork skills;
  • Ability to take ownership, function independently and effectively within teams and in a self-directed environment;
  • Solid communication skills, able to work with stakeholders from multiple levels and disciplines;
  • Fluency English with excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Please send us your CV in English.

Driving decarbonization and digitalization. Together.

Infineon designs, develops, manufactures, and markets a broad range of semiconductors and semiconductor-based solutions, focusing on key markets in the automotive, industrial, and consumer sectors. Its products range from standard components to special components for digital, analog, and mixed-signal applications to customer-specific solutions together with the appropriate software.

  • Welcome to Infineon Technologies Business Solutions in Porto! –

Infineon Technologies Business Solutions is a vibrant global hub, driven by diverse talents and an operational culture of excellence, in a privileged geographic location. The team of more than 25 nationalities works together in a dynamic, diverse and inclusive environment. We lead innovation and digital transformation, shaping the future of Infineon Technologies. At the heart of everything we do, people matter most. Our ultimate goal is to craft a unique experience for both our customers and employees.

At our site you will find a range of diverse teams that have built a reputation for delivering high-quality services for all Infineon in Finance, Procurement, Human Resources, IT, Audit, Legal, Compliance, Business Continuity and Sustainability, Cyber Security, Communication, Corporate Supply Chain Logistics and Sales & Marketing.

Porto is a powerhouse of ideas and solutions, a key player in the global company’s puzzle, delivering specialized services and innovative solutions.

Together, Infineon Technologies Business Solutions will continue to shape the future, driving innovation and excellence for years to come.

We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.

This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant´s experience and skills.

We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.

Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.

Click here for more information about Diversity & Inclusion at Infineon.

Title: Data Analyst w/ Power Platform
Description:
Job Description



Context / team / project
- Integrate into our Data Team (ETL, Data Management, BI), working together with NY Data Office, Paris and Porto team members, as a unique team, and help Porto to upskill on this practice.
- Bring a differentiating expertise to our clients and stakeholders with integrity and responsibility. (Sustainable impact)
- Be agile, accountable, and resilient, according to the circumstances (Entrepreneurial mindset)
- Purposely striving to succeed together, Porto and Paris, as one team with openness and confidence to improve knowledge, practice, framework, ecosystem (Collective intelligence).
- Contribute on local initiative and project from assessment, use case identification, data preparation, implementation, industrialization…
- Contribute to data community.
- Animate data awareness, training…


Years of Experience:
• > 5 years


Main Tasks & Responsibilities:


• Work closely with business users to understand their requirements and challenges around data analytics, data reconciliation, and Power Platform solutions.
• Translate these requirements into a data workflow, dashboards and/or applications solutions making use of Alteryx and Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI).
• Working closely with business analysts, data scientists, data engineers and developers.
• Analyze, estimate, and define tasks necessary deliver the data and power platform projects.
• Drive insights to answer business questions with data and visualizations, transforming data into actionable insights.
• Maintain and do the evolution of created assets during the projects.




Qualifications



Main Technical Requirements:


• BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;
• Experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools, for example Dataiku, Knime, etc.
• Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI;
• Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions;
• Good knowledge about SQL.



Other Requirements:


• Good level of English - minimum B2
• Able to be quickly autonomous, proactive
• Desire to learn more about new technologies as Power Platform and Dataiku.
• A real passion for learning, doing things better and helping others;
• Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required



Nice to have:


• Previous experience on financial area will be a big plus
• Knowledge in agile methodologies and tools (Scrum/Kanban);
• French is a big plus

Title: Data Support Analyst
Description:
Who is Clever?

Clever Advertising is a multinational digital brand serving the iGaming industry for the last 15 years with innovative advertising and technology solutions.

We are dedicated to your professional and personal growth in an environment that values knowledge-sharing and mentorship.




Why joining Clever?

Working with us means joining a diverse team where each member contributes to collective success, supporting one another through shared goals and passions. We not only focus on achieving excellent results but also enjoy the journey, making every day both fulfilling and fun.




Where will I work from?

Porto, Portugal.




What is my department like?

Our Technology Department is the driving force behind the innovations that propel our company forward. Committed to creating scalable and high-quality solutions, we work in a collaborative environment where every idea matters. Our teams of experts in development, infrastructure, security, and data intelligence are driven by a passion for solving complex challenges and delivering impactful results. We value diversity of thought and believe that the best solutions arise from collaboration between diverse and creative minds




What is my role like?

We are looking for a dedicated and detail-oriented Data Support Analyst to join our Data Management team. The ideal candidate will have effective communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively with various departments, ensuring that data operations are executed with accuracy and efficiency.




What will my daily tasks involve?

Assist the Data Management team in interacting with other departments, facilitating communication and collaboration to ensure that data projects meet the needs of all stakeholders.
Manage and resolve first-level support tickets related to data, including issues with dashboards, RPA bots, and data loading processes.
Monitor and ensure that dashboard loads are executed correctly, identifying and resolving any performance or loading issues.
Validate bots developed by the RPA team, ensuring they function as expected and comply with established requirements.
Create and maintain detailed documentation for data processes, RPA bots, and support procedures, ensuring that information is always up-to-date and accessible.




What is expected from me?

Minimum of 1 year of experience in data support, data analysis, or similar roles.
Familiarity with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Basic knowledge of SQL and ETL practices.
Ability to maintain technical documentation.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to solve problems quickly and effectively.
Attention to detail and accuracy when working with data are differentiating factors.




What can I expect from Clever?

A competitive remuneration package
Superior health benefits
Employee cafeteria featuring meals approved by our nutritionist
Wellbeing support through our Happiness Department, including 24/7 medical app access,complimentary nutritional consultations, psychological support, and wellness webinars.
A commitment to professional growth with tailored development plans and opportunities for internal career moves.
An education-rich workplace with access to the Clever Academy and language learning opportunities.
A balanced approach to work-life dynamics.




At Clever, we believe in diversity and inclusion as drivers of innovation. We foster a work environment free from discrimination, where everyone has equal opportunities to succeed.




Ready to make a Clever choice?

Title: Data Analyst(Tableau Expert)
HTML:
Procuramos qualidade e força de vontade !

Gostas de partilhar, celebrar o sucesso em conjunto?

Escutas, pensas e propões?

Utilizas o inesperado para ter sucesso?

Gostas de inspirar os outros com a tua atitude?


Be the NEX T Data Analyst(Tableau Expert)!!!


Main Responsibilities:


  • Design and maintain dashboards in Tableau;
  • Design data ingestion pipelines to gather data from various sources such as databases, APIs, and files;
  • Design data processing pipelines to clean, filter, and pre-process data for analysis;
  • Optimize data pipelines, framework code, cluster utilization, and configuration to ensure the best performance from pipelines;
  • Design, maintain, and enforce data governance and data catalog;
  • Maintain a coherent documentation of the framework, cluster, and projects;
  • Collaborate with data scientists, data analysts, and stakeholders to elicit data requirements and deliver effective solutions;


Technical skills:


  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field;
  • 3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst;
  • Strong proficiency in Python;
  • Knowledge of Apache Spark, Apache Hadoop, Airflow, and Presto;
  • Proficiency in SQL queries and a good understanding of database architecture;
  • Experience creating data sources and dashboards on Data Visualization software like Tableau and PowerBI;
  • Familiarity with in-house big data platforms;
  • Good knowledge of data modeling, data structures, data management, and best practices;
  • Familiarity with containerization and orchestration technologies.



A NEX T é uma consultora tecnológica que actua a nível nacional e internacional, com principal foco na área de IT, Marketing Digital, Data Mining, Data Science e Automação de Processos.

Oferecemos:

  • Remuneração compatível com a experiência profissional;
  • Evolução de carreira;
  • Acompanhamento personalizado;
  • Plano de Formação;
  • Oportunidade para fazer parte de uma equipa em grande crescimento.


Your NEX T step is right here!

Partilha o teu cv para fernando.garcia@nextengineering.pt com a REFª FGA

Title: Fraud Data Analyst
Description:
FARFETCH exists for the love of fashion. Our mission is to be the global platform for luxury fashion, connecting creators, curators and consumers.

We're a positive platform for good, bringing together an incredible creative community made up by our people, our partners and our customers. This community is at the heart of our business success. We welcome differences, empower individuality and celebrate diverse skills and perspectives, creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We are FARFETCH for All.




OPERATIONS

We're passionate about operational excellence, acting with our customers and partners always in our heart. Covering the entire order journey, we create our online content, secure payments and fraud process compliance, ensure order fulfilment and delivery, while providing customer and partner care. In a nutshell, we love to create seamless and memorable luxury experiences for our customers all around the world.




PORTO

Our Porto office is located in Portugal's vibrant second city, known for its history and its creative yet cosy environment. You can have an informal meeting in the treehouse or play the piano during your lunch break!




THE ROLE

Reporting to the Fraud & Risk Investigations Manager, you will be pivotal in executing and refining our fraud prevention activities. Utilizing advanced tools and comprehensive data analysis, you will optimize fraud detection methods, enhance overall performance, and achieve key KPIs across all regions and business units.




WHAT YOU'LL DO

Build and maintain fraud reports and dashboards in BigQuery and Looker to enable real-time fraud analysis.
Proactively identify and resolve fraud issues, ensuring we’re balancing fraud prevention with customer experience.
Daily monitoring and reporting of fraud KPIs.
Produce ad hoc reports to evidence live issues and trends and develop solutions to prevent and mitigate risk.
Design, test and implement rules & logic to prevent fraud and reduce false positives.
Apply advanced analytical techniques to extract meaningful insights from large datasets to minimise fraud chargebacks whilst balancing customer friction
Work independently on fraud analytics and the analysis of large datasets to ensure appropriate feedback is given to the internal and external ML models.
Communicate and escalate fraud trends in a clear and understandable manner to stakeholders.




WHO YOU ARE

3 + years experience working in a fast-paced e commerce fraud environment
Proficiency in SQL (SQL Server, BigQuery, or similar)
Experience using data visualisation tools (Looker, PowerBI, Tableau, or similar)
Ability to transform data analysis into defined actions and improvement
Knowledge of fraud systems and controls e.g Forter, Riskified, Accertify
Ability to work autonomously in solving complex technical problems
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey technical concepts to a non-technical audience
Advanced in English, both written and oral.




REWARDS & BENEFITS

Health insurance for the whole family, flexible working environment and well-being support and tools
Extra days off, sabbatical program and days for you to give back for the community
Training opportunities and free access to Udemy
Flexible benefits program




EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES STATEMENT

FARFETCH is an equal opportunities employer ensuring that all applicants are treated equally and fairly throughout our recruitment process. We are determined that no applicant experiences discrimination on the basis of sex, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, age, gender identity, ancestry, sexual orientation, veteran status, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. We continue to build our consciously inclusive culture as part of our Positively FARFETCH strategy throughout our business, partnerships and communities.




The Fraud Operations team's mission is to protect our customers and reduce risk on the Farfetch Platform, while contributing to the growth of our business.

Title: Lead Insight Analyst
Description:
Lead Insight Analyst required to joining our rapidly expanding Data Analytics team on a permanent basis in Portugal.

The opportunity:

As a Lead Insight Analyst you will have the opportunity to work on some of our largest projects and key accounts. Reporting to the Head of Data Analytics, you will be responsible for analysing digital behaviour in order to provide key, actionable insight and critical recommendations to our clients. This is more than just an insight role; it’s an opportunity to help shape the digital strategies of some of the world’s leading brands and retailers! You will be tool agnostic and you will use tools like Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics for tracking data, GTM, Adobe Launch or Tealium for implementing tags and a mixture of data visualization tool as well as Excel and Powerpoint for visualisation. Additionally, you will be managing a small team of Analysts and will be providing oversight to ensure that their delivering tool quality analysis outputs.

Please note that this job is a full-time position located in Lisbon or Porto, but the selection process will be conducted in English.

Please send over your CV in English




What you’ll be doing:

Shaping, sell and deliver large analytics programs of work.
Creating measurement plans that identify the customer behaviour to be tracked (you will work closely with our implementation analysts for this)
Establishing detailed reporting and visualisations that help our clients understand the performance of their digital channels
Using measurement tools to analyse digital user behaviours in detail, across a wide range of digital properties (websites, mobile applications, instore devices)
Creating detailed insight reports that cover key findings and recommendations
Presenting your findings to a senior-level client audience and helping them understand what it means for their business
Working with our internal UX and design teams to inform the creation of new websites and apps
Answering client queries and running training sessions with them
Having line management duties for a small team of analysts, including developing their skillset and driving the quality of their work

What we want from you:

Extensive experience working as a Lead Analyst providing insight, ideally in an ecommerce setting (client or agency)
Must have Advanced practical knowledge of Analytics tools (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Content Square)
Numerically adept in using Excel (or similar) to analyse data
Previous experience supporting junior team members
Highly proficient in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint
Extensive experience working with senior client stakeholders
Effective time management and multitasking abilities
A proven track record of delivering large insight projects for leading B2C organisations

What we can offer you:

Alongside the opportunity to work with some of the most exciting brands around the world, we’ll also prioritise your career development and help you grow your skills. We’ll empower you to make a difference, allow you to be yourself, and respect who you are.

We offer a great benefits package including hybrid working that works for everyone, social events, training opportunities, medical and dental insurance, life assurance, meal cards and much more.

Our personality and behaviours: We believe that we are what we do, not just what we say. Our shared values and behaviours show how to bring the VML Enterprise Solution's culture to life through the actions we all take every day:

Connect Meaningfully
Inspire Creatively
Include Purposefully
Approach Positively




Our brilliant, talented people are what makes VML Enterprise Solutions what we are. That’s why we look for people who go beyond and always push our thinking to be better than yesterday.

AT VML Enterprise Solutions

Our Enterprise Solutions division houses strategic consultants, creative and technical architects and skilled developers and operators that together help some of the world’s leading organisations to deliver outstanding digital experiences across all major routes to market worldwide: marketplaces, online retailers, D2C, B2B and social platforms. With over 4,200 experts in 55 operational centres across 34 countries, our capabilities span the entire buying journey from customer acquisition, through engagement, to conversion and loyalty, driving multi-channel growth for world-leading brands.

We work with some of the most exciting brands such as The Coca-Cola Company, EY, Bosch, Unilever, Ford, DFS, Mercedes-Benz, Johnson & Johnson, Nestlé, Sainsbury’s, Selfridges, Shell and Tiffany & Co. We’ve built over 500 platforms for brands and retailers and generate in excess of $29bn annually for our clients and work with over 50 strategic partners including Adobe, SAP, Salesforce, HCL, Shopify, Sitecore, BigCommerce, commerce tools and Acquia. Our reputation is based on our people, and we believe we have some of the best in the business.

As our business grows internationally, we’re looking for new people to join us on our journey to inspire and take a key role in shaping some of the best commerce solutions, services, and websites in the world. Working as a team, no problem is insurmountable; we share in our client’s successes and believe that anyone can show creative bravery no matter what their role is in the team.

In our Lisbon or Porto office, you’ll join a team of other specialists who are always ready to help each other. The team is part of our Enterprise Solutions network and works in coordination with our Local and EMEA client leads.

#LI-EMEA #LI-HYBRID #LI-JM1

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
BARKYN’S VISION

Barkyn delivers health and happiness to pet families around the world.

Our mission is to impact an important part of dog families' lives by giving them more years, more joy, and a deeper bond. We're changing the pet market and how e-commerce should feel: human, personalized, and beautiful. We were considered one of Europe’s Top 100 Startups by Wired, Top 50 Technology Fast by Deloitte, and a success case by Web Summit.

THE ROLE

We're creating a loved brand in Europe, and this is where your story begins!

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will help our brand's evolution across Europe with the right data insights.

Specifically, we expect you to:


Execute Data initiatives, mainly reporting dashboards and in-depth data analysis
Define and improve the architecture of our Data structure and Dashboards to be aligned with our business goals
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams and team managers to ensure seamless execution and efficient prioritization



Mandatory requirements:


Minimum 7 years of experience at multiple companies and at least in one B2C business
Hands-on experience on reporting, analytics, dashboards and BI
Experience with BigQuery or similar and Google Cloud
Experience with Python



Brownie points:


Experience with AI models
Experience at a medium-sized startup, ideally at a scale-up stage
Dog owner.

Title: Full Stack Data Analyst
Description:
🤔Who are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 740 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 10 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto and Casablanca. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.




🔎We are looking for a Full Stack Data Analyst




We are looking for a talented Data Analyst with data science skills, expertise in ETL and DataViz solution.

The candidate will lead dashboard projects from End to End in cyber security risk management.

You will work closely with the other departments and entities within Cyber to identify business needs, design effective data models, develop and maintain dashboards using POWERBI, TABLEAU, DATAIKU and PostgreSQL for data processing and analysis.




YOUR MISSIONS:




Understand the company’s requirements and identify KPIs for the development of dashboards related to cyber security risk management.
Collect, clean, and transform data sets using ETL tools to create effective data models.
Develop and maintain dashboards and ensure the accuracy and availability of data related to managing cyber security risks.
Use Dataiku and PostgreSQL for data processing and analysis, including statistical techniques.
Leverage on machine learning algorithms to identify additional insights and define non explicit correlations between indicators.
Present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, making recommendations for action when appropriate to improve Dashboard production.
Continuously improve the accuracy and usability of data by monitoring data quality and developing new data models.
Demonstrate excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to identifying problems and provide solutions.







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:




A bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related subject.
3+ years of experience as data Analyst, developing Dashboard and DataViz
Knowledge of algorithms is a plus and will enable the candidate to be a force for proposing useful content related to cyber security risk management.
Expertise with POWERBI, TABLEAU, DATAIKU, PostgreSQL and ETL tools.
Fluent in English.
Hybrid regime in Lisbon or Porto Office (depends on your location).




🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Jumia (Full Time)
Description:
About Jumia:

Jumia believes that technology has the potential to transform everyday life in Africa for the better. Jumia was built to help consumers access millions of goods and services conveniently and at the best prices while opening up a new way for sellers to reach consumers and grow their businesses.

Listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in 2019, Jumia is the leading e-commerce company in Africa, operating in 11 countries. The Jumia platform consists of a marketplace, which connects sellers with consumers, a logistics service, which enables the shipment and delivery of packages from sellers to consumers, and a payment service, JumiaPay, which offers a safe and easy solution to facilitate online payment transactions. The company offers goods across a broad range of categories, such as phones and electronics, home appliances, fast-moving consumer goods, fashion and beauty.

What you will be doing


Lead the execution of data analysis projects, including collecting specifications, creating dashboards, and conducting in-depth analyses to drive business decisions
Develop and maintain complex SQL queries, Power BI dashboards, and Excel models to support various business units
Mentor and support junior colleagues in data analysis techniques, query optimization, and dashboard creatio
Perform quality assurance on data outputs, including queries, dashboard results, and visualizations to ensure accuracy and reliability
Communicate analytical findings and insights to senior stakeholders in a clear, concise, and actionable manner
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to standardize processes, improve team performance, and enhance overall efficiency
Assist the team manager in handling ad-hoc requests and managing cross-team projects
Contribute to the development of best practices and documentation for data analysis processes.


What we are looking for


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field
Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in the e-commerce or retail sector
Advanced proficiency in SQL, Power BI, and Excel; familiarity with JIRA and Confluence is a plus
Demonstrated experience in creating and maintaining complex dashboards and conducting in-depth data analysis
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to translate business requirements into analytical solutions
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences
Experience in mentoring junior team members and contributing to process improvements
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Knowledge of e-commerce metrics and KPIs is highly desirable
Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and data visualization best practices
This job description outlines the key responsibilities and requirements for a Senior Data Analyst at Jumia, emphasizing the technical skills, leadership qualities, and industry knowledge needed for success in this role.


We Offer:


A unique experience in an entrepreneurial, yet structured environment
A unique opportunity of having strong impact in building the African e-commerce sector
The opportunity to become part of a highly professional and dynamic team
An unparalleled personal and professional growth as our longer term objective is to train the next generation of leaders


Please ensure to only apply for jobs with Jumia through our official website.

Jumia will never charge you a fee to apply for a job: be wary of websites that claim to help you apply for a Jumia job or that charge a fee to get you a job.

Title: Data Engineer / Data Visualization Specialist
Description:
📢 A nossa missão:

A Ivy Partners é uma empresa suíça de consulting que contribui para a evolução das empresas nos seus desafios estratégicos, tecnológicos e organizacionais.

A nossa missão é oferecer aos nossos colaboradores uma carreira que contribua positivamente para a sua realização e bem-estar, criando um ambiente de apoio onde todos são valorizados e capacitados com formação e perspectivas de crescimento.

👩‍💻🧑‍💻 Como Data Engineer / Data Visualization Specialist irás:

- Projetar e manter pipelines de dados eficientes e escaláveis com Snowflake e Databricks.

- Desenvolver e otimizar modelos de dados para suportar relatórios e dashboards no Power BI.

- Trabalhar em estreita colaboração com as equipas de negócios para compreender as suas necessidades de dados e criar soluções apropriadas.

- Implementar processos ETL (Extração, Transformação, Carga) robustos e eficientes.

- Manter a integridade e qualidade dos dados, monitorizando e resolvendo questões de desempenho.

- Criar e atualizar documentação técnica e guias de utilização.




🏅 Sobre ti!

Esta posição será perfeita para ti se:

- Educação: Licenciatura em Ciência da Computação, Engenharia de Dados, ou área relacionada.

- Experiência: Mínimo de 5 anos como Engenheiro de Dados, com foco em visualização de dados.

- Competências Técnicas:

- Proficiência em Snowflake e Databricks (Avançado)

- Experiência com Power BI (Confirmado)

- Conhecimentos sólidos em SQL e Python ou outras linguagens de programação relevantes (Avançado)

- Competências avançadas em processos ETL

- Competências Interpessoais:

- Capacidade de comunicar eficazmente com stakeholders técnicos e não técnicos

- Proficiência em inglês é uma vantagem

E se humanamente falando:

És analítico, rigoroso e tens um bom espírito de equipa
Tens fortes capacidades de comunicação e uma mentalidade fantástica

🤝 A Ivy, também é sobre:

Zelo | Oferecemos um ambiente de apoio onde todos são valorizados e capacitados com formação e perspetiva de crescimento.

Confiança | Trabalhar connosco é estabelecer uma parceria baseada na confiança, profissionalismo e transparência em todos os momentos.

Inovação | Potenciamos a transformação digital efectiva através de uma combinação única de tecnologia inovadora e pensamento criativo.

Responsabilidade | A comunidade está no centro de tudo o que fazemos, e levamos essa responsabilidade a sério, trabalhando arduamente para criar um impacto positivo.

🚀 Juntares-te à Ivy significa fazer parte de uma aventura desafiante a cada passo!

Obrigado por considerares juntar-te a nós, estamos ansiosos para ouvir mais sobre ti!

- Experiência: Mínimo de 5 anos como Engenheiro de Dados, com foco em visualização de dados.

- Competências Técnicas:

- Proficiência em Snowflake e Databricks (Avançado)

- Experiência com Power BI (Confirmado)

- Conhecimentos sólidos em SQL e Python ou outras linguagens de programação relevantes (Avançado)

- Competências avançadas em processos ETL

- Competências Interpessoais:

- Capacidade de comunicar eficazmente com stakeholders técnicos e não técnicos

- Proficiência em inglês é uma vantagem

E se humanamente falando:

  • És analítico, rigoroso e tens um bom espírito de equipa
  • Tens fortes capacidades de comunicação e uma mentalidade fantástica

🤝 A Ivy, também é sobre:

Zelo | Oferecemos um ambiente de apoio onde todos são valorizados e capacitados com formação e perspetiva de crescimento.

Confiança | Trabalhar connosco é estabelecer uma parceria baseada na confiança, profissionalismo e transparência em todos os momentos.

Inovação | Potenciamos a transformação digital efectiva através de uma combinação única de tecnologia inovadora e pensamento criativo.

Responsabilidade | A comunidade está no centro de tudo o que fazemos, e levamos essa responsabilidade a sério, trabalhando arduamente para criar um impacto positivo.

🚀 Juntares-te à Ivy significa fazer parte de uma aventura desafiante a cada passo!

Obrigado por considerares juntar-te a nós, estamos ansiosos para ouvir mais sobre ti!

Title: Advanced Analytics Consultant
Description:
Na Deloitte, oferecemos uma experiência profissional que inspira talentos como tu a transformar o mundo como o conhecemos, a torná-lo mais humano, eficiente e tecnológico. Somos um Tech Hub internacional e estamos à procura dos melhores especialistas em tecnologia para se juntarem aos nossos centros de excelência e à nossa comunidade, para desenvolverem soluções únicas e inovadoras nos mais variados e complexos projetos de transformação, de Portugal para o mundo.

És tu quem procuramos?


Formação superior nas áreas de Engenharia Informática, Engenharia Eletrotécnica e de Computadores ou similar
Anos de experiência: 2 a 5 anos em consultoria e em Business Intelligence/ Analytics
Conhecimentos sólidos em data mining & Machine Learning
Conhecimentos técnicos em R, Python, SAS Machine Learning e IBM Watson ou ferramentas similares
Conhecimento da língua Inglesa no domínio falado e escrito
Autonomia, capacidade analítica e espírito crítico
Capacidade de comunicação e trabalho em equipa
Orientação para o cliente e para resultados
Comunicação, relacionamento interpessoal, trabalho em equipa e colaboração
Resolução de problemas, capacidade analítica e espírito crítico
Organização, planeamento e orientação para a qualidade dos projetos
Orientação para o cliente e para resultados



Desenvolve uma carreira à tua medida


Num contexto de trabalho diverso que permite um desenvolvimento e aprendizagem contínuos
Através de um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira personalizado (skills/ oportunidades técnicas e funcionais), adequado ao momento, às tuas necessidades e objetivos
Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimensão e impacto relevante nesta área de especialização
Acesso ilimitado às maiores plataformas de aprendizagem online (Linkedin Learning e Udemy)
Oportunidade de formações e certificações nas mais recentes tecnologias, nomeadamente em tecnologias Cloud



Vive uma cultura de união


Uma cultura de inovação e excelência que nos torna líderes e percursores de tendências
Um ambiente amigável, de respeito, confiança, transparência e informalidade
Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de líderes e especialistas
Uma oportunidade para fazeres parte das nossas comunidades (de Tech, inovação, desporto e outros interesses) e para participares ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social.



Sobre a Deloitte

Na Deloitte, nunca trabalharás sozinho. Vais integrar os mais variados e desafiantes projetos e fazer parte do nosso Global Solutions Center, onde poderás colaborar de forma integrada com outras equipas da rede global Deloitte. Terás sempre alguém ao teu lado para te inspirar, ajudar e desafiar a expandir os teus horizontes, enquanto exploras soluções tecnológicas diferenciadoras. Aqui, ao encontrares um ambiente dinâmico, colaborativo e humano, terás a oportunidade de desenvolver a tua melhor versão.

Além disso, as nossas equipas em Portugal têm projeção internacional, o que demonstra a nossa forte liderança global em diversas expertises tecnológicas.

Se tens interesse em explorar e desenvolver as tuas competências e fazer parte de equipas que desenvolvem soluções nas tecnologias líderes de mercado, então estás no lugar certo!

Somos mais de 5.500 pessoas em Portugal, das quais mais de 2.600 trabalham em áreas tecnológicas, a partir de escritórios e Digital Studios em Lisboa, Porto, Viseu, Coimbra e Faro e de polos tecnológicos em Braga, Setúbal e Leiria.

Keywords: Sobre a Deloitte; Technology; Consulting; Anos de Experiência

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
M/F







DESAFIO:




Esta posição, integrada na equipa de Data Intelligence, constitui uma oportunidade única para se focar na centralização, coerência, fiabilidade e velocidade dos dados para várias áreas de negócio. É uma função essencial para otimizar o desempenho das análises e do conhecimento obtido pela organização.

Este profissional terá um papel fundamental no desenvolvimento de métodos e processos que garantam a organização correta e segura dos dados, que envolve a criação de modelos de dados consistentes e normalizados, além de assegurar a qualidade dos dados armazenados, preparados e disponibilizados através de pipelines para uso analítico e operacional.










PRINCIPAIS RESPONSABILIDADES:




• Desenvolver e Automatizar Pipelines: criar, automatizar e manter pipelines de dados usando processos CI/CD para transformar dados em informações úteis e acionáveis.

• Colaboração: colaborar com analistas de negócio e dados para melhorar os modelos de dados que alimentam as ferramentas de BI, aumentando a acessibilidade dos dados e promovendo decisões orientadas por dados em toda a organização.

• Governança de Dados: assegurar que as políticas de segurança de dados estejam alinhadas com os regulamentos de proteção de dados.

• Monitorização da Qualidade dos Dados: desenvolver, testar e manter sistemas para monitorizar a qualidade dos dados, garantindo que os dados de produção estejam sempre atualizados e disponíveis para os principais intervenientes e processos empresariais.

• Desenvolvimento de Estratégia: colaborar com todas as unidades de negócio e equipas técnicas para desenvolver a estratégia de uma arquitetura de dados a longo prazo.

• Apoio à Equipa: partilhar conhecimentos técnicos e de dados com outros membros da equipa, ajudando na coordenação de projetos e prioridades.










PERFIL:




• Formação Académica: Licenciatura Informática, Engenharia, Ciências de Dados (áreas similares)

• Experiência: +3 anos de experiência prática em engenharia de dados

• Conhecimentos Técnicos: experiência com plataformas cloud, modelação de dados, batch e streaming workloads, e bases de dados

• Tecnologias: familiaridade com tecnologias como Snowflake, Airflow, Python, Kafka, Azure Data Factory, entre outras

• Microsoft BI: conhecimento em tecnologias Microsoft BI (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power BI)

• Habilidades Analíticas: capacidade analítica forte e atenção aos detalhes

• Relacionamento Interpessoal: excelente relacionamento interpessoal e habilidade para trabalhar em equipa

• Proatividade: dinamismo, proatividade e autonomia.







O QUE OFERECEMOS:




• Ambiente Inovador: trabalho com as tecnologias mais recentes num ambiente dinâmico

• Crescimento Profissional: oportunidades de desenvolvimento profissional contínuo

• Colaboração: um ambiente de trabalho colaborativo e de apoio mútuo.

• Impacto Real: participação em projetos que têm um impacto direto e significativo nos negócios.







Se és apaixonado por dados e ambicionas fazer parte de uma equipa que valoriza inovação e colaboração, gostaríamos de ter a oportunidade de te conhecer!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique, and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, teamwork.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: Senior (5+ years)

Type of position: Hybrid from Braga. Candidates must be living in Portugal already!

The amazing you, will have:


Expertise in PySpark
Expertise in SQL
Airflow and GCP is a nice to have
Good English Knowledge
Familiarity with Scala is a bonus
Hybrid model in Braga



Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term;
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity;
Free training programs: our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster;
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work;
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you;
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home;
Full Onsite projects: if you prefer the company of your colleagues!

Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psychologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!


Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Innovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Visualization Engineer - Saudi Arabia
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there’s a constant need to be innovative.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there’s always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

The Data Visualization Engineer is responsible for extracting, preparing, and cleansing data, as well as designing and creating visually engaging and informative data visualizations.

As a part of your job, you will:


Collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and objectives for visualization projects.
Connect and integrate visualization tools with various data sources, ensuring seamless and efficient data access.
Extract, prepare, and cleanse data from various sources, ensuring data quality, integrity, and accuracy for visualization purposes.
Design and develop visually engaging and insightful data visualizations using appropriate tools and techniques.



What are we looking for?


BSc and/or MSc in Computer Science or similar;
Previous experience with Data Visualization, Business Intelligence, and ETL processes;
Proficiency in Power BI;
Proficiency in data prep tools or components as Tableau Prep, Power Query, Alteryx, or similar;
Solid understanding of data extraction, preparation, and cleansing techniques to ensure data quality and integrity;
Experience with database management systems, SQL, and various data formats, such as CSV, JSON, and XML;
Ability to connect and integrate visualization tools with various data sources, such as APIs, databases, or data lakes.



Personal traits:

Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients

Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy

Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included

Willingness to collaborate with other players

Strong communication skills

We want people who like to roll up their sleeves and open their minds. Believe this is you? Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions – addressing Telecommunications, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services and other markets' strategic opportunities.

Serving Clients in 25+ countries, Celfocus delivers solutions such as accelerating digital network transformation in Autonomous Networks, elevating and monetising business services in B2B2x ecosystems, and providing highly relevant customer experiences through Hyper-personalisation solutions.

  • Previous experience with Data Visualization, Business Intelligence, and ETL processes;
  • Proficiency in Power BI;
  • Proficiency in data prep tools or components as Tableau Prep, Power Query, Alteryx, or similar;
  • Solid understanding of data extraction, preparation, and cleansing techniques to ensure data quality and integrity;
  • Experience with database management systems, SQL, and various data formats, such as CSV, JSON, and XML;
  • Ability to connect and integrate visualization tools with various data sources, such as APIs, databases, or data lakes.


Personal traits:

Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients

Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy

Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included

Willingness to collaborate with other players

Strong communication skills

We want people who like to roll up their sleeves and open their minds. Believe this is you? Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions – addressing Telecommunications, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services and other markets' strategic opportunities.

Serving Clients in 25+ countries, Celfocus delivers solutions such as accelerating digital network transformation in Autonomous Networks, elevating and monetising business services in B2B2x ecosystems, and providing highly relevant customer experiences through Hyper-personalisation solutions.

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Description:
Do you want to be part of building Vestas new Design Centre?

Vestas Technology & Operations > Research & Development (R&D) > Plant Data

Vestas Technology & Operations, a cornerstone of Vestas, is committed to innovation, product development, and continuous improvement. We aim to develop high products and technologies that build down the cost of energy, delivering maximum value to both our customers and Vestas.

As a part of Vestas Technology & Operations, the Modelling & Analytics, Plant Data team is responsible for the creation and management of products and services related to Vestas Plant Data Offerings. Our accomplished and diverse team of Data Engineers is focused on designing products that facilitate data collection, processing and storage from thousands of power plants across the world. The team also supports data storage and conducts data analytics on a hybrid data platform setup that supports multiple data applications for our customers.

Our overarching mission is to reduce the cost of energy by harnessing the extensive data collected and stored by Vestas from power plants worldwide. Join us in this mission to make a meaningful impact on the future of renewable energy.

Responsibilities

Potential candidate is expected to be 70% hands on with the data engineering team and engage with the architects and other stakeholders (PM, PO etc) for the remainder.

Perform upstream and downstream impact analysis of complex data flows which involved multiple source systems.
Contribute actively to design and delivery of migrating data products from legacy to cloud setup.
Facilitate key POC’s & mentor team data engineers on technical solutions.
Facilitate and contribute to formal Code & design reviews.
Oversight and contribution to managing operational data products (Level 3 Support).
Working with Architects, SME’s, business and product stakeholders in identifying data products and workloads in legacy warehouse.
Participate and co-own product architecture and drive strategic roadmap for plant data warehouse.

Qualifications

Master's degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Software engineering or related fields are preferences.
+7 years of experience in on-prem & cloud data warehousing domain.
Formidable command on advanced SQL & ELT design patterns & data flow/ workload performance optimization.

We envision that you possess experience in designing, building, and maintaining data products within hybrid environments.

Additionally, you should identify with at least one of the following qualifications:

Experience in data workload migration from on prem to cloud ETL + Data Warehouse.
Experience in Azure services + Snowflake + DBT would be an added advantage.
Extensive hands-on data modelling experience in cloud data warehouse and data structures.
Experience with SQL server, SSIS & SSAS would be a positive factor.
Familiarity with agile development methodologies and DevOps practices.
Experience with data mesh implementation,
Python, Py-Spark, Databricks would a bonus.

Competencies

On individual capacity, we anticipate that you:

Possess a collaborative and open-minded nature, eager to contribute to a globally diverse cross-functional team within the organization
Display curiosity and enthusiasm for developing innovative data products that generate value
Thrive in diverse environments and exhibit flexibility in adapting to evolving conditions
Exhibit good communication skills, coupled with a practical, problem-solving approach to accomplishing tasks
Embrace a commitment to continuous learning and a desire to contribute to the collective growth of the team

What We Offer

An aspirational position that lets you work on the key data areas in Vestas and be part of projects that redefine the Vestas data landscape.

Opportunity to work with and address challenges related to processing, developing and delivering value from true large scale industrial IOT data.

Take part in creating a green & sustainable future for the planet.

Additional information

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible, as we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis. To apply for this opportunity please submit your resume in English.




BEWARE – RECRUITMENT FRAUDIt has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, https://www.vestas.com/en/careers/our-recruitment-process

DEIB StatementAt Vestas, we recognize the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in driving innovation and success. We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, "Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.

About VestasVestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore. Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 173 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field. With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future. Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity. To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
As one of the world's leading logistics companies, we have opened a new IT Hub in Porto, Portugal. Our vision is to lead the transformation of the logistics industry into a technology-enabled, data-driven value chain. We envision a world where product teams can easily discover and consume data across domains and source systems on a central data platform in a consistent way. We will achieve this by building a data network based on the new KN technology platform. Within this data network, data stores are the curated data products that represent the KN business as a digital twin. Join our fascinating and international working environment and be part of the team responsible for the further development of our digital logistics processes.

Your Role

As an IT Business Analyst for our Data Stores, you will be the domain and application expert, working closely with the engineering team. You will play a key role in designing and maintaining the conceptual and logical domain model behind our data products covering sea, air and road logistics. You will translate user cases and requirements relevant to our stakeholders into development-ready user stories. You will also work closely with the highly skilled engineering team in Hamburg and Porto and support them throughout the entire software lifecycle!

Your Responsibilities


Support all product management related tasks required to build and operate our data products.
Support the product team in requirements engineering: You will define the requirements of a use case and support the prioritization of requirements.
Specify user stories and epics to translate the roadmap into manageable elements to be implemented according to agile principles.
Test implemented features and support the team with root cause analysis in case of bugs.
Support product management by articulating tactical and strategic requirements to management, business stakeholders, and developers.
Support the maintenance of product related documentation.
Provide guidance, support, and mentorship to other team members.


Your Skills And Experiences


3+ years of requirements engineering/feature specification experience in software development or experience from working in a business intelligence team.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing skills in English. Enjoy writing concise user stories and have strong experience writing good documentation.
Ability to gather and analyze requirements, abstract and communicate complex content to various stakeholder groups at all levels of the organization.
Experience working with data modeling or other formal specifications in complex environments, ideally at enterprise scale.
Self-starter, able to motivate the team in a dynamic environment. Team player, you enjoy working collaboratively and are willing to develop and empower others.
Master's degree in a logistics field with demonstrated technical aptitude or master's degree in a technical field (computer or natural sciences, engineering, business) with demonstrated interest in logistics.
Experience with the applied tech stack is a plus (Jira, Confluence, Enterprise Architect, AWS, Kafka, XML/XSD, Avro).
Fluency in written and spoken English. Portuguese and/or German is a plus.


Good Reasons to Join

Your work has a direct impact on the future of logistics and IT. Your team is made up of experts who are shaping the IT industry in Portugal and around the world. We want you to feel comfortable in our working environment, where you will be dealing with different cultures. That is why we offer flexible working hours and the opportunity to work remotely. We value teamwork, continuous learning and diversity. Kuehne + Nagel offers you a tailor-made career with individual planning and team leaders who will support you in every way. On a personal level, we support you with a wide range of work-life balance options, supplementary health insurance and our EAP - Employee Assistant Program.

Title: Data Engineer - GCP
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Engineer - GCP for a project based in Porto (hybrid - twice a week at the office).


Responsabilities:

  • Develop, maintain, and optimize data transformation workflows using Google BigQuery;
  • Create and manage views in BigQuery to support data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes;
  • Collaborate with data analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical solutions;
  • Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular data quality checks and troubleshooting;
  • Monitor and improve system performance to ensure efficient data processing;
  • Document data transformation processes and maintain comprehensive records of data workflows.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field;
  • 2-5 years of experience in a data engineering role, or a similar position, is required;
  • Proficiency with SQL and experience in writing complex queries;
  • Experience with Google BigQuery and other Google Cloud Platform tools;
  • Strong understanding of ETL processes and data transformation techniques;
  • Demonstrable experience with data modeling and data warehousing;
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail;
  • Fluent English (mandatory).


If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to catarina.sa@decskill.com with reference “CS/DataEngineer_GCP”.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Engineer (Hybrid @Porto)
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: 6+

Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week at Porto Office)




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field;
6+ years of experience as a Data Engineer;
Expertise on end-to-end Data Pipeline Development, ETL processes and Alteryx;
Knowledge in Data Mesh concepts (Starburst, Trino);
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala;
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases;
Experience with Big Data technologies such as Databricks, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Kafka;
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto (Portugal);
Fluency in English is mandatory.




To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you´ll have (plus):

French AND/OR Portuguese fluency.







Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!




Who are we?




Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.
